loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy is 41 years old and he is married with two children. He lives and works in Bim Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thủy has a service business repairing electronics. He has been involved in this business for six years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With his business profit, Thủy hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for his kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ephraim's Group

texts.en:
Ephraim is a 65-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ephraim has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Ephraim described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Ephraim’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Davlatmo Group

texts.en:
The Davlatmo group consists of three members, Davlatmo and her two sons. They live in a rural area in the South of Tajikistan. Her two sons do not have higher education and work as taxi drivers. The brothers share one taxi, and work hard together everyday to support their families by rotating shifts.

A few weeks ago, their taxi broke down. They are unable to work and support their families without their taxi. At the moment, they do not have enough money to repair the taxi, and requested a loan to pay for the repair. They are grateful for the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to enable him to plant the crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools to repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 70 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Erlinda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
Moses is 50 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has two children and is married. As a group leader, Moses is representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Moses's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. In addition to receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

Moses and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa atiende los oficios de la casa, tienen dos hijos que asisten a la escuela.

José, trabaja como seguridad publica, desde hace cinco años labora de esta manera, su trabajo está a 40 minutos desde su casa y su horario es algunos días, desde las 6:00 a.m. durante tres días. 


José, necesita el préstamo para cancelar unos muebles que adquirió en una comercial.

Sus sueños son, comprar otros muebles que le faltan y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old, he studied up until ninth grade, he is married and his wife takes care of the home, they have two children who attend school. 

José works in public security, he has been doing this work for the last five years. He has to travel 40 minutes to get to work, some days he works from 6:00am in the morning and it will last for three days. 

José needs this loan to pay for furniture that he bought at a store. His dream is to buy more of the furniture that they are lacking and give his children a good quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for furniture that he bought at a store.

loans.name: Melisa's Group

texts.en:
Melisa is a 50-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Melisa has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Melisa described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Melisa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 38 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Eunice is representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Eunice's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Eunice and her group will receive a total of 11 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk and gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more farming tools for higher production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more farming tools for high production

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Chin’s group live in a rural village in Paillin province in Cambodia. Chin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller by selling groceries to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yona

texts.en:
Yona, a father of five children who are still in school, is married and supports his family with his business income. He runs a genge (grocery store) selling fruits and vegetables together with another small business selling milk in the same place. Yona he has been in this business for three years and dreams of expanding his business to raise enough income. He work from 6am to 8pm per working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

Yona is a good client of Tujijenge Tanzania, he has taken several loans which he used to improve his business. He used the previous credits, paid back successfully, to purchase more stocks for his genge and milk. Yona's business, now makes a good profit and this is due to Kiva's support. He used the profit received to support his family's needs. He bought a cupboard, TV, radio and manged to build a house.

He is now requesting his 15th loant which he will use to buy liters of milk and genge stocks. He will hold himself accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy liters of milk and genge (grocery store) stocks.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 48 years old and a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gemma has a buy-and-sell oyster business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more oysters to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his stationary shop.

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy another photocopying machine, and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and improve standards. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to have a powerful stationary shop.

loans.use: to buy another photocopying machine

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara lets you know her sincerest thanks because the loan that was granted to her helped her a lot in improving her business. That loan was utilized to buy additional grocery items and other supplies necessary to increase her product inventory.

Having repaid her previous loan, Clara would like to avail herself of a new loan amounting to 15,000 PHP. This new loan will be used to purchase additional stock, including groceries, toiletries, and beverages. By offering more items for sale, her customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Clara to sustain her family's needs.

Clara aims to have the business expansion she desires to become a successful businesswoman in the future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jhoncy Arcides

texts.es:
Jhoncy, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltero, pero tiene dos hijos que estudian, pero que no viven con él.

Jhoncy, trabaja como vendedor de pan especial desde hace 10 años, inicio vendiendo en una bicicleta, ahora lo hace en carro, ya que en el trabajo se ha esforzado y ha logrado superarse, no tiene otras actividades económicas, antes solo sembraba maíz y otros granos básicos; su trabajo está a 5 minutos, nadie más se involucra en su trabajo y su horario es desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta que termina el producto que lleva. 

Jhoncy, necesita el crédito para comprar llantas y realizare un pequeño ajuste al motor, el préstamo mejorara su carro ya que lo andará en mejores condiciones.

Sus sueños son, poner su propia panadería y que sus hijos se preparen academicamente, el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la  condición del carro.
texts.en:
Jhoncy, age 30, has a sixth-grade education. He has two children, both in school, but they don't live with  him.

Jhoncy works selling bread loaves and has ten years of experience. He began selling by bicycle, but now he sells by car. He has worked hard and managed to get ahead; he has no other paid jobs. Before this, he just planted corn and other staple grains. His work is five minutes away from his home and he doesn't work with anyone else. His schedule is from 8:00 am until he runs out of merchandise.

Jhoncy needs this loan to buy tires and make a small adjustment to his motor. This loan to improve his car will help him get around in better condition. His dreams are to open his own bakery and to see his children well prepared academically. This loan will help him improve the condition of his car.

loans.use: buy tires and adjust his car's motor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, Juma has been working hard to manage his hardware store, which sells hardware items. 

To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of hardware items and will help Juma to generate greater profits to boost his standard of living. 

Juma hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hardware items

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Harriet to generate and increase her profits. 

Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her land.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys de 57 años de edad vive en su vivienda propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando con el apoyo de ella.  Gladis es una mujer muy trabajadora gracias a eso hace 5 años logro instalar en su casa un molino  con lo que obtiene sus ingresos económicos y abastece las necesidades de su hogar junto con su esposo el cual es un pequeño ganadero y sus ventas son medianas. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para ampliar su vivienda, en la cual construirá un cuarto donde estará el comedor y así mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys, age 57, lives in her own home with her husband and her two children, who are in school with her support. Gladys is a hard working woman; five years ago, she managed to install a mill in her home. With what she earns from this, she and her husband manage to supply their home with the essentials. He works as a small cattle rancher with medium sales. 

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and steel so that she can expand her home. She plans to build a dining room and thus improve her quality of life little by little.

loans.use: buy building materials to expand her home

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 57 years old, married and supports a family of six members. She has been operating as a small scale farmer for the last 27 years and earns KES 12,000 per month. 

Rael has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to add more farming tools for high production. She plans to use the anticipated profits to improve her farming activities for more income.

Her future hopes and dreams are to produce a quantity of quality farm supplies for the market.

loans.use: To add more farming tools for high production

loans.name: Deysi Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Deysi vive en Tarija, es soltera, pero convive por más de 12 años con el padre de sus hijos. Ella tiene tres hijos a quienes apoya moral y económicamente.La Sra. Deysi es una mujer extremadamente trabajadora y de condición humilde. Ella necesita un préstamo para poder comprar semillas y fertilizantes para sembrar su siguiente cultivo de papa, el cual realiza dentro de su Comunidad, de esta forma podrá seguir proveyendo a su familia, velando siempre por el bienestar de sus hijos. La Sra. Deysi produce dos veces al año en una sola hectárea de terreno, esta es su principal fuente de ingreso para el sustento de toda su familia. En ocasiones siembra también lechuga y maíz, los terrenos en los que siembra cuentan con un sistema de riego instalado para toda la Comunidad. Actualmente, la Sra. Deysi vive en la casa de su padre, pero ella cuenta con un terreno en otra Comunidad, el cual consiguió gracias a su trabajo incansable y la buena administración de sus recursos.
texts.en:
Deysi lives in Tarija, is single, but has lived for more than 12 years with the father of her children. She has three children, whom she supports morally and economically. Deysi is an extremely hardworking woman of humble condition. She needs a loan to be able to buy seeds and fertilizers to sow her next potato crop, which she does inside of her community. In this form, she will be able to continue providing for her family, always ensuring the well being of her children. 

Deysi produces twice a year in only one hectare of land. This is her principal source of income for the sustenance of her entire family. On occasion, she also plants lettuce and corn. The land on which she sows has an irrigation system installed for the whole community. Currently, Deysi lives in the house of her father, but she has land in another community, which she got thanks to her tireless work and good administration of her resources.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his potato crop, in this form he will be able to continue providing for his family, always ensuring the well being of her children.

loans.name: Lila Esther

texts.es:
Lila tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas corporales, maquillaje, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 15 años, este negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de colonias, perfumes, cremas corporales, entre otros productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad de productos de belleza con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lila is 47, in a common-law marriage, with two children in her care. She lives in her own house in a rural zone of the Oyotún district. It's a community dedicated to agriculture and animal raising that's found located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling beauty products like perfumes, body creams, makeup, among others. She's been doing this activity for 15 years. This business is found located in her home. 

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of colognes, perfumes, body creams and other products to increase the stock of her business. This will help her to have a greater diversity of beauty products with the goal of increasing her business of the same and satisfying the needs of her clients which will generate her greater income and will improve the quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy colognes, perfumes, body creams and other products to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Nadgie

texts.en:
Nadgie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

Nadgie earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Nadgie supplements this income with earnings from her hollow-block-making business.

Nadgie dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
La elaboración de albardas es un trabajo minucioso y de mucha dedicación, Jairo tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a la fabricación éstas, y junto a su hermano ha podido sacar adelante el negocio que hoy goza de mucha demanda. Él importa sus productos a diferentes partes del país, lo cual le genera jugosas ganancias.  

Por ello, solicita un crédito para la compra de cuero procesado, que le servirá para la elaboración de sus productos. Asimismo,  espera abrir otro local, con las ganancias de las ventas de albardas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
The making of saddles is a meticulous job of much dedication. Jairo has more than 15 years' experience dedicating himself to making these, and along with his brother, he's been able to get the business ahead and today he enjoys a lot of demand. He imports his products from different parts of the country, which will generate him juicy profits.

Because of this, he's applying for a loan for the purchase of processed leather, which will serve him for the making of his products. Furthermore, he hopes to open another place with the profits of the saddle sales and therefore increase his production.

loans.use: to buy processed leather.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa, de 53 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya están casados y viven aparte y su hija de 13 años de edad aún vive con ella.

Nicolasa, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y también tienen una pequeña venta de sorbetes y paletas, mientras su esposo trabaja en el cultivo de café, en una cooperativa que está a unas horas de su casa.

Nicolasa, necesita el crédito para comprar madera y reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que el invierno del año pasado lo daño mucho.

El sueno de Nicolasa, es poder mejorar su vivienda y tener más comodidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolasa, 53, didn't have the opportunity to study. She's married and the mother of 5 children, four of whom are already married and they live apart and their daughter, 13 years old, still live with her.

Nicolosa works as a homemaker and also they have a small sale of sorbets and popsicles. Meanwhile, her husband works growing coffee in a cooperative that's a few hours from her house.

Nicolasa needs the loan to buy wood and repair the roof of her home, since last year's winter damaged it a lot.

Nicolasa's dream is to be able to improve her home and have more comforts for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Santana, de 40 años de edad, es una persona honesta y responsable, junto a su esposa procrearon 2 hijas, pero tiempo después decidieron separarse por motivos personales, pero él se hizo responsable de sus dos hijas.- Hoy en día, son adultas, solo una hija sigue viviendo con él.

Santana, toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura, por lo cual tiene mucha experiencia en los diferentes cultivos de granos básicos.

El crédito lo necesita para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, ya que quiere sembrar de regadillo para que le genere un poco más de ganancias.

Santana, sueña con cultivar 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y poder tener mejores ganancias para poder comprar lo que necesita día a día
texts.en:
Santana, 40 years old, is an honest and responsible person. Along with his wife they procreated two daughers, but some time later they decided to separate themselves for personal reasons, but he made himself responsible for his two daughters. Today they are adults, only one daughter continues living with him.

All of his life, Santana has worked in agriculture, for which he has a lot of experience in the different basic grain crops.

He needs the loan to cultivate 14,000 square meters of land, since he already wants to plant with irrigation so that it generates him a little bit more income.

Santana dreams of cultivating 28,000 square meters of corn and to be able to have more income to be able to buy what he needs day by day.

loans.use: to cultivate 14,000 square meters of land.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a que tuvo que trabajar, está soltera y vive con su madre y su hermana; su hermana trabaja, mientras que su madre se encarga de los oficios domésticos.
	
Alicia, trabaja en una empresa de limpieza de pescado desde hace un par de años, ella desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en cualquier cosa.
    
Alicia, necesita el crédito para reparar todo el techo de su casa, porque se aproxima el invierno y el techo de su casa está en muy mal estado; con la puesta de techo nuevo, no habrá más goteras, ni se mojara ella y su familia.

El sueño de Alicia, es tener su casa en buen estado, ya que su madre trabajo toda su vida por esa casita y ahora ella quiere lo mejor para su madre y su hermana.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 28, has a ninth grade education. She couldn't continue her studies because she had to start working. She is single and lives with her mother and her sister. Her sister also works while their mother runs the household.

Alicia works at a company that cleans fish. She's been there for a couple years. She has worked at a variety of jobs since she was very young.
	
Alicia needs this loan to repair the roof of her home. Winter is coming soon and her roof is in very bad shape. With a new roof, there won't be anymore leaks and she and her family won't get wet.

Alicia's goal is to have a home in good condition. Her mother has worked all her life for this little home and now Alicia wants to make it better for her mother and sister.

loans.use: repair the roof of her home before the rainy season

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is a 40-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person and is representing her group of eight farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Esther has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Esther described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Esther’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 11 years, Loyce has been working hard to manage her clothing sales business.

To help expand her business, Loyce has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase additional clothing to sell, and will help Loyce generate greater profits and increase capital.  

Loyce hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her land.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various store goods

loans.name: Eugenia Mabel

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Ilusión.
En este lugar vive La señora Eugenia, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 8 y 7 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Eugenia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, cortinas, edredones, entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta ella aprovecha las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas sus hijos están en la escuela y sale con mayor libertad y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella  deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 5 años con su negocio el mismo que está mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos por lo cual esta agradecida con la institución.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area of Cadí, in the parish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and cattle, the communal loan group “Nueva Ilusión” meets every fifteen days.

This is where Eugenia lives. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship, 8 and 7 years old. Both of the children are in school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Eugenia is a person who likes to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education. She works in commerce, selling all kinds of clothing, sheets, curtains, and blankets, among other things. She sells door-to-door, taking advantage of the morning hours since that’s when her children are at school and when it’s easiest for her to go out. She also sells from her home, where her clients come when they need clothing items. She sells on credit and collects weekly. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and it’s improving with the help of the loans, for which she is grateful to the institution. 

This loan is buy pants, shirts, and blouses, among other clothing items. She has been in the communal loan group for three cycles and she likes it because the loans are of much help. Her dream is give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has 6 children, with 4 of them currently in school.  For the past 6 years, Aron has been working hard to manage his grocery store, selling various grocery items. 

To help expand his business, Aron has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy maize, beans, milliet, cassava, and sorghum to sell, and will help Aron to generate greater profits and boost business.  

Aron hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, milliet, cassava, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Tormenta Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Tormenta, está conformado por 4 mujeres miskitas (Rosa, María, Sofía, Sandra),  originarias de Bilwi; municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día para el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios. Se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento, para mejorar su nivel de ingresos y calidad de vida. 

 Rosa: Es una mujer cordial, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario, con cualidades de líder. Tiene 51 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como buzo. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir a los gastos del hogar desde hace 6 años inicio con sus ahorros una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera con un capital de C$2,000 (Dos Mil Córdobas Netos). Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, pan, huevo, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Su sueño ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
The united group Tormenta (Storm) is comprised of four Miskita (an indigenous group) women: Rosa, María, Sofía, Sandra. They are from Bilwi, in the city of Puerto Cabezas. These women are entrepreneurs who work every day to grow their small business. They organized this group about five years ago with the goal of accessing financing so that they could improve their incomes and the quality of life.

Rosa is a kind-hearted woman, the coordinator of the united group, and a true leader. She is 51 years old, married, and has five grown children. Her husband works informally as a diver. Six years ago, Rosa started a small grocery store out of her home with the goal of having her own source of income and helping with the household expenses. Her store is run out of a hallway in her house, which is built of traditional materials, and she launched it using her savings, capital amounting to C$2000. She is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, chips, bread, eggs, soda, and more. Her goal is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: stock her small grocery store

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 43 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school.  For the past 20 years, Amos has been working hard to manage his produce sales business. 

To help expand his business, Amos has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sacks of produce, and will help Amos generate greater profits to foster growth and development.  

Amos hopes that in the future he will be able to add more stock.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of produce.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 47 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 14 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her timber/wood business, in which she sells timber. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and increase profits. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to have more stock.

loans.use: buy more timber

loans.name: Madina Khaitsa

texts.en:
Madina is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Madina has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, in which she sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, and will help Madina to generate greater profits and boost business. Madina hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past three years, Simon has been working hard to manage his lodging, which operates rentals. 

To help expand his business, Simon has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more rooms to the lodges, and will help Simon to generate greater profits and improve standards. Simon hopes that in the future he will be able to have a good business.

loans.use: to add more rooms to the lodges

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children with 1 of them currently in school.  For the past 20 years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells grocery items. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase tomatoes, oranges, bananas,onions, and green peppers to sell.  This will help Getrude generate greater profits and buy another plot of land.  Getrude hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, oranges, bananas, onions,and green peppers to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school.  For the past 4 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells grocery items. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase tomatoes, oranges, bananas, onions, and green peppers, and will help Mary generate greater profits. 

Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, oranges, bananas, onions, and green peppers to sell.

loans.name: Josselyn Adriana

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Ilusión.
En este lugar vive la señora Josselyn, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 8 meses de nacida. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Josselyn es una joven madre y esposa que le gusta trabajar para ayudar con los gastos que genera la crianza de su pequeña, ella se dedica al comercio, vende  sabanas, cortinas, edredones, entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro veces por semana y aprovecha que su mamá le cuida a su bebé, deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y desde que recibe los créditos para ella todo se le ha facilitado ya que cuenta con dinero para poder invertir más, ella agradece a la fundación y a las personas y grupos que la ayudan para que ella pueda recibir su crédito y así mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y darle lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
The members of the loan group "Nueva Ilusión" meet every two weeks in the district of Cadí, in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hard-working people who work in agriculture and livestock raising.

Señora Josselyn lives in this place. She is 19 years old. She is in a free union relationship from which she has a daughter who is eight months old. Her husband is a driver.

Doña Josselyn is a young mother and wife who likes to work to help with the expenses that raising her little one generates. She works in commerce. She sells sheets, curtains, and quilts, among other items. Her form of selling is door-to-door. She goes out three or four times a week and makes use of her mother to care for her baby. She leaves [her goods] on credit and collects every week. She has been working in this business for three years, and since she has received the loans everything has been easier for her, since she has the money to be able to invest more. She is grateful to the foundation and to the people and groups who help her so that she can receive her loan and thus improve her quality of life.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, and blouses, among other articles of clothing. She has been in the loan group for four cycles, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to have her own house and give the best to her baby.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Shodmehr

texts.en: Shodmehr is an active boy. He was born in the northwest part of Tajikistan in 1995. He is living in a gorgeous place which is famous for ancient ruins and historical sightseeing. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a student at the university. He studies languages and is interested in being a linguist. He likes to study Arabian language. Shodmehr is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to pay for his higher education costs. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education costs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase néré seeds

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy tiene 61 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada de material rústico con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de bebe tejida que es elaborada por ella misma, asi como también a la venta de cerveza, cuenta con 30 años dedicándose a este rubro, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. El destino del crédito será para la compra de insumos y herramientas para la elaboración de ropa para su negocio, esto incrementará su nivel de ventas lo que le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucy is 61 years old. She lives in a rented, rustic material house with her partner and her youngest son in the rural part of the Pucará district, a community dedicated to agriculture and livestock; it is located in the Jaén Province, Region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountain range of Peru.

She makes a living selling knitted baby clothes that are elaborated by herself, as well as selling beer. She has 30 years commited to this line or work. Her business is located at her home. The use of the loan will be for the purchase of supplies and tools for the production of clothing for her business; this will increase her sales level, which will generate greater income and thus she will be able to improve her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tools for the production of clothing for her business.

loans.name: María Yulay

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Portoviejo de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Alianza. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada de esta  relación tienen  cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 8  y 2 años de edad, dos  estudian en colegio y uno  en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
Doña María al ver que su marido no gana mucho y con lo que él hace no alcanza para los gastos, hace mas de 5 años surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí empezó a vender solo  productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros víveres, pero con la ayuda de los créditos ella ha ido aumentando la variedad de productos con los cuales ha aumentado la clientela, ella también allí tiene unas mesas de billar en las cuales muchas personas se acercan a divertirse y ella cobra por las horas del uso de las mesas,  trabaja con la ayuda de su marido más que todo en horas de la noche.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes entre otros productos. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque con los  créditos empezó su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Nueva Portoviejo in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Crédito Alianza” communal loan group meet every fifteen days.

This is where María lives. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children from this relationship. They are 6, 14, 8, and 2 years old. Two are in high school and one is in primary school. Her husband is a merchant. 

María, upon seeing that her husband doesn’t earn a lot and it isn’t enough to cover their expenses, she decided more than five years ago to open a small grocery store in her home. She began selling products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and detergents, among other grocery items. But with the help of the loans, she has been increasing the variety of products, which has grown her number of customers. She also has some billiards tables, where many people come to have fun and she charges by the hour for the use of the tables. She works with her husband’s help, mostly in the evenings.

She will use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and detergents, among other products. She has been in the loan group for more than 5 years and she likes it because she started her business with the loans. Her goal is to continue growing her store day by day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Josephne

texts.en:
Josephne is 35 years old and married with 6 children between the ages of 1 and 15 years old.  3 of them attend school.  She sells foodstuffs and she has been in this business for the past 3 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy additional sorghum and beans to resell.  The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional sorghum and beans to resell.

loans.name: Massan Victorine

texts.fr: Agée de 65 ans Massan est une femme célibataire qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants à sa charge. Etant très entreprenante et active dans le développement, Massan vend de l’huile rouge dans son quartier. Ce commerce lui permet de bénéficier d’un revenu pour favoriser l’éducation des enfants. Massan s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour passer une commande de bidons d’huile rouge, Massan demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Massan, aged 65, is an unmarried woman who lives in Adidogomé with her two children in her care. Being very entrepreneurial and active in development, Massan sells red oil in her neighborhood. This business enables her to benefit from an income for supporting her children’s education. She gets her supplies once a month at the market. To put in an order for containers of red oil, Massan is asking for this loan to realize her goals and to have a good profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase 29 containers of red oil

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Peter, who has been a farmer for more than 40 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. Peter has always been described as a very reliable person, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

Peter started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2012, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs but also a solar light as part of his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. He can’t wait to send his children to school using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

Peter’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Hoy Rosalía tiene 56 años, sigue con su trabajo de artesana, comenta que le esta yendo cada vez mejor, esta es una señora es muy emprendedora, teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y su marido se encarga de venderlos a cuotas. Comenta que este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva.
Ella comenta que sus anteriores prestamos le han sido de mucha ayuda y hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder comprar tilos, bastidores, agujas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Rosalia is now 56 years old.  She continues with her artisan work, which she says is going better and better.  She is a very enterprising woman.  She weaves blankets and handmade tablecloths and her husband sells them in installments.  This is her third loan with Kiva.

She says that her previous loans have been of much help and now she requests a new loan to be able to buy thread, embroidery frames, needles, and other things so that she can continue her work as she has been doing.  She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to continue growing in this way.

loans.use: to buy thread, embroidery frames, needles, and other things

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, both of who are currently in school. For the past four years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his retail business, in which he operates a retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more household items, and will help Stephen to generate greater profits and will help with growth and development. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more household items

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the kampala region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child.  For the past 2 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells essential goods. 

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more bread, cooking oil, blue band, soap, and detergent, and will help Paul generate greater profits and sales.  Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more bread, cooking oil, blue band, soap, and detergent to sell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 29 years, married and supports a family of eight children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 13 years and earns KES 9,000 per month.

Damaris has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizers for her farm for more production. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her farming activities.

Her future hope and dream is to open a farm tools center.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm for more production

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard is a 40-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of nine farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Richard has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Richard described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Richard’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjovi vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 32 ans. Célibataire, Adjovi est une jeune femme qui œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son progrès. Adjovi vend de la bouillie préparée à l’aide du maïs dans son quartier afin d’avoir son revenu. Adjovi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de maïs pour préparer la bouillie, Adjovi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et satisfaire favorablement ses clients.
texts.en: Adjovi lives in Adidogomé and is 32 years old. She is a young unmarried woman who works energetically to progress in life. She sells porridge made with corn in her neighborhood in order to have an income. She gets her supplies once a month at the market. To put in an order for tubs of corn for making porridge, Adjovi is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase 75 tubs of corn

loans.name: Rabbeca's Group

texts.en:
Rabbeca is 54 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Rabbeca has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family, and although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rabbeca also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rabbeca's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Portoviejo de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Alianza. 
En este lugar vive la señora Olga, tiene 38 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tienen  tres hijos de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad, todos estudian  en colegio y escuela. El marido es pintor.
Doña Olga es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, sobrecamas, cortinas entre otros productos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres o cuatro  días a la semana en sus recorridos y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento para ella y sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, sobrecamas, entre otras cosas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella financia su  negocio el cual le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños es darles la mejor educación  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the Credito Alianza group meet in the Nueva Portoviejo block of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, and renowned for many years as the city of tamarinds. This is where Olga lives, 38 years of age and in a common-law marriage that has given her three children ages 16, 14, and 10 and all going to school or high school. Her husband is a painter.
Olga is a woman who loves to work to get her kids ahead, she works as a salesperson selling sheets, bedspreads, curtains and other products. She does her selling door to door, going out three or four days a week in her travels and also sells out of her house where her most familiar customers make their way to. She sells her products on credit and collects once a week. She's been working in this business for 10 years with which she has supported herself and her children.
This loan is for buying sheets, bedspreads, and other things. She's been in the Credito group for 5 years and enjoys it because of the loans that she has financed for her business, allowing her to move forward. Her dream is to provide the best education for her children

loans.use: To purchase sheets, bedspreads, etc.

loans.name: Yandry Javier

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Portoviejo de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Alianza. 
En este lugar vive el señor Yandry, tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre,  tiene un hijo de 2 años y su  esposa esta por dar a luz a su segundo hijo. Su mujer es ama de casa. 
Don Yandry es un hombre muy trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no les falte nada, el se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y los fines de semana el se desplaza a otros cantones lugares en los cuales tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran, son  4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con lo cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos para sus ventas. Lleva 4 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un carro para ir a realizar sus ventas.
texts.en: Every two weeks the members of the Credito Alianza group meet in the Nuevo Portoviejo section of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, and renowned for many years as the city of tamarinds. This is where Yandry lives, a 22 year old who's in a common-law marriage and has a 2 year old child. His wife is about to give birth to their second child, she's a homemaker. Yandry is a very hardworking man who does whatever he can to provide for his family. He works as a salesperson, selling clothing and shoes door to door and on weekends traveling to other areas where he has many customers that always buy from him. For 4 years he has worked in this business, which has gotten his family ahead. This loan is to purchase clothing and shoes for him to sell. He's been in the Credito group for 4 cycles and he likes it because the loans have financed his business. He dreams of having a car to use for his selling.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 45-year-old married woman, from the village of Eniseli, Georgia.  She lives with her parents-in-law and husband, who has a state job and works as a veterinarian.  In spite of her high education, Manana was unable to start a stable job and became hired as a worker.  She generates insignificant income and is very eager to be involved in her own business. 

According to her husband's profession, Manana decided to open a veterinary pharmacy at a good location in her village.  Now, she needs financial support to purchase a stock of medicines and to have money for working capital.  Manana has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Manana thinks the business will be profitable because it is in a good location and is the only business of this kind in the area.  With support of the Start Up program Manana will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties of starting a business.

This loan will greatly assist Manana and she will be able to improve her economic situation and provide her family a better style of life.

loans.use: to start her own veterinary pharmacy business.

loans.name: Egnoname

texts.fr: Egnonam est une jeune femme célibataire  âgée de 28 ans. Egnonam qui vit à Adidogomé et  travaille  activement pour son épanouissement. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Egnonam vend des produits d’alimentations générales afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Egnonam achète ses provisions trois fois par mois sur un marché local du quartier. Pour commander des sacs de riz, Egnonam demande ce nouveau crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer plus de bénéfice pour agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Egnonam is a young unmarried woman who is 28 years old. She lives in Adidogomé and works actively for her development in life. To achieve her goals, she sells grocery items in order to make a profit. She purchases her provisions three times a month at the local neighborhood market. To put in an order for sacks of rice, Egnonam is asking for a new loan to realize her purchase and to bring in more profit to expand her commerce.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of rice

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Agée de 56 ans, Rose est une femme mariée qui habite à Adidogomé. Rose a deux enfants et exercer une activité, elle vend des charbons de bois. Rose tire de bons profits et arrive à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants grâce au crédit antérieur. Rose s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois, Rose nécessite ce nouveau prêt pour financer sa commande et réaliser plus de gains pour l’épanouissement de son foyer.
texts.en: Rose, aged 56, is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé. She has two children and operates a business selling charcoal. She makes a good profit and manages to support her children, thanks to past loans. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market. To purchase sacks of charcoal, Rose needs this new loan to finance her order and to make more profit for her household to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Agée de 55 ans, Cécile est une femme mariée qui vit avec deux enfants à Adidogomé. Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Cécile vend des pagnes en se déplaçant dans le quartier. Cécile réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Cécile demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Cécile, aged 55, is a married woman who lives with he two children in Adidogomé. For the sake of their development in life, she sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) by going door to door in the district. She makes a profit thanks to this business. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. To purchase lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth, Cécile is asking for these funds to put in an order and to have a profit margin for helping her to do better at covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a few lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Wapanka Raya Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario WAPANKA RAYA, es un grupo mixto integrado por 2 mujeres y 3 hombres luchadores, de la etnia miskita de la comunidad de Tuapi que se localiza a 16 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tuapí está rodeado de agua, la principal actividad económica es la pesca artesanal en botes tradicionales conocidos como “cayucos”. El nombre de WAPANKA RAYA, que tomaron para su grupo solidario es en lengua mískita que significa Un Nuevo Camino.

CONNY MAYELA: Es una joven emprendedora de 18 años de edad, que trabaja día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de su pequeño negocio de venta de mariscos. Es integrante del grupo solidario, se organizaron recientemente para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. Está casada con un hijo de un año de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como pescador. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos, que los distribuye a precios accesibles en el mercado y paradas de buses de Bilwi. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar mariscos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
The group, Wapanka Raya, is a hardworking team of two women and three men of the Miskito ethnic group in the Tuapí community that is located 16 kilometers from the city of Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. 

Tuapí is surrounded by water, and the main economic activity is fishing in traditional boats known as “cayucos.” The group’s name, Wapanka Raya, means “a new path” in the Miskito language.  

Conny Mayela is an entrepreneurial, 18 year-old young woman who works every day determined to grow her small business of selling seafood. 

She is a member of the group, which recently organized in order to obtain a loan from Pana Pana. She is married with a one-year-old son, and her husband works informally as a fisherman. 

She has made a living for two years selling seafood that she distributes at affordable prices in the markets and bus stops in Bilwi. She is asking for her first loan in order to buy seafood. Conny dreams of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a soapstone shop

loans.name: Phenny

texts.en: Phenny is a widowed woman. She has two children who are 5 years and 9 years old. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. Her business goal is to have a great business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business and have a good life.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 28 years old, married to Obare and supports nine family members. She has been operating a retail shop for the last four years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 9,000. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to use this to add more stock of sugar to sell to her customers in her retail shop, and earn a living from it. She hopes to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and expand her retail shop.

loans.use: To add more stock of sugar to sell to her customers in her retail shop, and earn a living from it.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Jose Nemias

texts.es:
Jose tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad rural que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este negocio y tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 20 years old.  He is single, and lives in his own house, made of rustic material, in the district of Querocotillo, a rural community involved in agriculture and cattle raising.  It is located in the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works growing coffee.  He has five years of experience in this business, and he has good personal and work references in his district.  He will use the loan to purchase compost and fertilizer to provide maintenance for his coffee crop.  This way, he hopes to offer higher quality coffee to his customers, which will generate greater profit that will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer to provide maintenance for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Cherry Ly

texts.en:
It was almost two years ago when Cherry had requested her last loan with Kiva. She was operating a buko shake franchise store before and she was able to repay the loan used for the business. The business didn't quite work well for her, and that is why she has shifted to retailing of Red juice products and direct selling items like shoes, bags and wallets.

Cherry is an active member of CCT and she wants to borrow again, this time in the amount of PHP 20,000 to be used to buy additional merchandise and supplies she needs to incorporate with her existing inventory. She is determined to succeed in this new venture so she can provide her child a better life in the future. She sincerely looks forward to your positive response in this regard and says that she is very thankful for whatever amount comes from you.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients and pay for the maintenance of the equipment for her business.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 65 years old and is often referred to as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Matete District, formed by 11 farmers, including himself.

John has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2011 because he wanted to get the best-quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, John’s Group will receive a total of seven solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mary' Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Mary will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Mary plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Mary’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of four acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Juma's Group

texts.en:
Juma is 42 years old and has eight children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 15 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Juma has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Juma also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Juma's Group will be able to receive a total of 17 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nabwayo's Group

texts.en:
Nabwayo's Group is formed by eight farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Nabwayo, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 35 years old, is married and has two children. Nabwayo has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Nabwayo isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Nabwayo will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Nabwayo's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en: Shahodat is an active woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in a rural area where agriculture is the most common business be in. She is married and has three children. She participated in three days of training for Startup clients provided by IMON. She was informed and learned how to start a new business in her area. She asked for a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy livestock and start to do business, and help her husband with the finances. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start to do business, and help her husband with the finances

loans.name: Pescadin Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Rebeca, Claudia Carolina y Anely), pertenecen a la etnia miskita, viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace 2 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos, mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos.

Rebeca: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven cordial de 22 años de edad, con cualidades de líder. Soltera, con el propósito de apoyar a su mamá con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus 4 hermanos, desde hace 10 años se dedica  a la venta de mariscos de manera ambulante en el mercado y paradas de buses de Bilwi. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos: pescados, camarones, conchas, caracoles, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con estudiar su carrera universitaria y ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three tenacious women (Rebeca, Claudia Carolina, and Anely).  They belong to the Miskito ethnicity.  The live in Bilwi, a municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  They organized themselves two years ago, with the purpose of accessing funding for their small shellfish sales businesses, improving their profits, improving their living conditions, being able to cover the basic necessities of their homes, and guaranteeing education for their children.

Rebecca is the coordinator of the solidarity group.  She is a warm-hearted young woman of 22 years, with the qualities of a leader.  As a single woman, in order to support her mother with household expenses and with education for her four siblings, she has worked selling shellfish for 10 years as a street vendor in the market and bus stops of Bilwi.  She is requesting funding to buy more products: fish, shrimp, conches, and snails, among other products.  She dreams of attending university and being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more products, including fish, shrimp, conches, and snails, among other products.

loans.name: La Concepcion Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, integrado por un hombre y dos mujeres luchadoras (Andrés, Lucrecia Lucia y María Auxiliadora), pertenecen a la etnia miskita, viven en la comunidad kilómetro 43, de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace 3 meses con el propósito de accesar a financiamiento mediante la metodología grupal, para mejorar sus pequeños negocios de pulpería y poder y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por KIVA, le permitieron diversificar sus productos, actualmente vende refrescos, leche en polvo y gaseosas.

Andrés: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, es un hombre con cualidades de líder, tiene 36 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos menores de edad. El trabaja como agricultor. Con el propósito de apoyar a su esposa, desde hace 7 años le estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y cuidado de sus hijos. Está solicitando su segundo préstamo para incrementar el inventario de su pequeño negocio: Granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas, papel higiénico. Su sueño es dedicarse a la comercialización de cerdo.
texts.en:
La Concepcion is a mixed solidarity group, composed of a man and two determined women (Andrés, Lucrecia Lucia, and María Auxiliadora) that belong to the indigenous ethnic group, Miskito.  They live in the Kilometer 43 community of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas.  They organized themselves 3 months ago for the purpose of accessing financing through the group, in order to improve their small grocery store businesses and to improve their living conditions, to be able to cover basic needs at home, and to ensure the education of their children.

The first loan from KIVA allowed Andrés to diversify his products.  Currently he sells refreshments, powdered milk, and sodas. 

Andrés is the coordinator of the solidarity group.  He is a man with leadership qualities.  He is 36 years old, is married, and has two young children.  He works as a farmer.
