Elle fait cette activité depuis 05 ans n’ayant pas assez de fonds pour développer  au mieux l’élevage de ses mouton ,elle a fait recourt à L’IMF pour avoir plus de fonds pour acheter plus de moutons .Elle est motivé dans le travail tout en lançant un défi  pour subvenir au bien être de la famille (la sante l’éducation de ses enfants) ,elle à un rêve dans l’avenir ,l’augmentation de son capital  pour être indépendante dans les jours à venir.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires de la localité et après élevage elle fait la vente dans les mêmes foires de localité, elle réalise un bénéfice prévisionnel de 80000f par cycle de prêts.
texts.en: Datio is the woman on the left of the photo, who is holding the rope attached to the sheep. She is a Malian woman who is 54 years old, a widow, and mother to six children, one of whom is educated and five who are not. Datio raises sheep and has been doing this for the past five years. Since she does not have sufficient funds to develop her sheep-raising activity further, she is turning to the IMF to get more funds so she can buy more sheep. She is motivated by her work but it is a challenge for her to provide for her family's well-being (her children's health and education) and she dreams in the future of being able to raise her capital and become independent. She gets her supplies from local fairs and, once she has raised her sheep she sells them in the same local fairs; she makes and estimated profit of 80,000 francs per loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
L’homme qui a les pagnes est Alou
Agée de 36 ans marié,  père de 05 enfants  dont 03 sont scolarisés et 02 non scolarises dont 04 sont parrainés. Alou est un commerçant pagnes et d’habits sportif, dévoué dans son activité de commerce, n’ayant pas assez de fonds pour continuer   son  commerce, il a fait recourtà l’IMF pour avoir de l’argent afin  d’acheter plus d’articles (d’habits sportifs  t- short , pagnes, portables ;pièces détachées ) pour revendre. Avec le profit  gagné, il  subvient aux besoins de sa famille tel que la sante, l’éducation et le revêtement de ses enfants.
Il s’approvisionne dans les foires locales et urbaines en marchandises et après approvisionnement il fait la vente aux comptants tout en réalisant une marge bénéficiaire entre 50000 et 80000f par mois. Il est souvent confronté  à quelques obstacles tel que la mévente  et le monopole des clients sur le marché. 
Il a un  rêve, c’est d’être indépendant dans les jours à venir et que l’aide apporte par l’IMF soit continuel.
texts.en: The man who is holding the "pagnes" (pieces of fabric) in the photo is called Alou. He is 36 years old, father to five children, three of whom are at school and two who are not. Four of the children are fostered. Alou buys and sells "pagnes" and sports clothing, and he is committed to his business. Since he does not have sufficient funds to continue his business, he is turning to the IMF to get enough money to buy more articles (sports clothing, T-shirts, "pagnes", mobile telephones and spare parts) for resale. With the profit he makes he provides for his family's needs: his children's health, education and clothing. He gets his supplies in local and town fairs, and then sells them for cash making a profit of between 50,000 and 80,000 francs a month. He is often confronted by problems such as a slump in sales and a monopoly of customers in the market. He has a dream to become independent in the future and to get continuous help from the IMF.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes", sports clothing, mobile telephones and spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Kogltaaba Villa Group

texts.fr:
Mme YVONNE est responsable du groupe KOGLTAABA VILLA. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Madame fait de l’élevage depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle compte acheter avec l’argent octroyé, 03 moutons et 03 sacs de mil.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour aider ses enfants avec la scolarisation et épargner. Elle ambitionne être la plus grande dolotière  du village.
texts.en:
Yvonne is in charge of the Kogltaaba Villa group. She is married and mother to five children. The eldest is 15 years old and the youngest three. Four of the children go to school and Yvonne has five dependants.

She has been raising livestock for the past ten years and gets her supplies in the surrounding markets. With the loan she is granted, she is planning to buy three sheep and three sacks of millet. She wants to use the profits from the loan to help out with her children's education and make some savings. Her ambition is to be the largest manufacturer and seller of dolo (a beer made from millet) in the village.

loans.use: to buy three sheep and three sacks of millet.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Дилафруз молодая женщина 33 лет. Она родилась и выросла в семье дехкан. Дилафруз замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Дилафруз очень жизнерадостная женщина и любящая мать . Дилафруз по профессии швея. Она шьет национальные платья. 
В данное время Дилафруз вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Дилафруз обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a young woman 33 years of age. She was born and raised in a family of farmers. Dilafruz is married and has one child. Dilafruz is a very cheerful woman and loving mother. Dilafruz is a seamstress by profession. She sews national dresses. 

At present, Dilafruz and her husband want to renovate the home they live in, in order to improve their living conditions. However they do not have enough funds. Dilafruz has turned to Arvand regarding this and wants to receive a loan to buy building materials to renovate her home. She hopes for a favourable outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Zharkynai

texts.ru:
Жаркынай, 39 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении многих лет она занимается предоставлением швейных услуг: кройки, реставрации, шитья (платьев, халатов, безрукавок, праздничных костюмов, постельного белья). Жаркынай уже год арендует контейнер возле поселкового рынка, в центре поселка.  Кроме этого Жаркынай с мужем сдают земельный участок в аренду за 5,000 сом (KGS). Супруг на протяжении 5 лет работает слесарем на Гидроэлектро станции. Также Жаркынай на 0,75 Га собственного земельного надела занимается полеводством, выращивая арбузы для реализации. Таким образом совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет около 23,700 сом (KGS).
Так как Жаркынай уже достаточно длительный период времени сама занимается предоставлением швейных услуг, она решила начать торговлю трикотажной тканью, так как предварительно рассчитала, что на этот товар будет большой спрос. Эта идея возникла у Жаркынай еще, когда она только начинала свое швейное дело, но средств на тот момент не было и воплотить идею в жизнь не получилось. 
Недавно Жаркынай решила окончательно, что займется тем делом, о котором давно мечтала, она решительно нашла место для реализации (контейнер), он расположен в центре поселка. Место хорошо проходимое, Жаркынай ожидает, что клиентов будет достаточно. Ткань она собирается покупать на крупном рынке региона по оптовой цене, а затем перепродавать у себя в магазине. Жаркынай планирует 1 раз в неделю ездить за товаром, нанимая автомобиль и перевозчика. У Жаркынай уже имеются потенциальные покупатели. В стартовом бизнесе будет помогать вся семья. Жаркынай планирует не завышать стоимость перепродажи ткани, так как нужно в первую очередь привлечь клиентов, а конкурентоспособная цена поспособствует этому. Жаркынай ожидает ежемесячную прибыль от торговли в сумме около 35,000 сом (KGS).
Жаркынай обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку первоначальной партии ткани для реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в развитие своего нового дела, и обучение своих сыновей, старший из которых- студент, а младшие собираются в этом году поступать в университет.
texts.en:
Zharkynai is 39 years old, she is married and has 3 children. 
She has completed a secondary education, and for many years she has been providing sewing services: cutting-out, restoration, sewing (dresses, gowns, jerkins, festive costumes, bedding). 
For a year now Zharkynai has been renting a container near the market in the village center. 
Besides she and her husband are renting out a plot of land for 5,000 som (KGS). 
Zharkynai's spouse has been working as a mechanic at a hydropower station for 5 years. Also Zharkynai has 0.75 ha of land, which she uses for crop cultivation - she is growing watermelons for sale. Thus, her and her husband's total monthly income is about 23,700 som (KGS).
Since Zharkynai herself has been providing sewing services for a sufficiently long time, she decided to start trading knitted fabrics. She had previously calculated that this product is in great demand. This idea came to Zharkynai even when she was just starting her sewing business, but at the time she didn't have funds and thus couldn't implement the idea.
Recently Zharkynai decided that she will finally take on the business she has been dreaming about for a long time, so without hesitation she found a place for the sale of goods  (the container). It is located in the center of the village. As the location is well traveled, Zharkynai expects that there will be enough customers. 
She is going to buy fabrics at the largest markets in the region at a wholesale price and then resell in her store. 
Zharkynai plans to hire a car and a carrier to go purchase the goods once a week.  Zharkynai already has potential buyers, and the whole family will help with this start-up. 
Zharkynai intends to not set the resale prices high, as it is necessary to attract customers in the first place, and a competitive price will contribute to this. 
Zharkynai's expected monthly income from trading totals to about 35,000 som (KGS).
Zharkynai asked the "Bai-Tushum" Bank  for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase the initial batch of fabric for sale. She plans to invest the proceeds from the loan in the development of her new business and the education of her sons. Her eldest son is a student and her youngest are going to enroll into the university this year.

loans.use: to buy knitted fabrics in order to realize her dream and start her own resale business.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза 33 летняя жительница города Душанбе. Она замужем и унее 2 дочери. Дочкам 5 и 3 лет. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине, что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Шахноза в городе живет вместе папой, мамой, сестрой, братьями и детьми. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи у себя дома. Шахноза 4.5 года занимается шитьем одежды. Ей в работе нравится ежедневный доход. Она шустрая и честная женщина. Шахноза решила улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она давно планировала ремонтировать дом. Но она не смогла копить деньги для ремонта дома.  Шахноза обратилась за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать дом. За счет кредита она купить стройматериалы, и на оставшуюся  часть денег она будет оплатить за услуги мастера.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a 33-year-old resident of Dushanbe city. She is married and has two daughters. Her daughters are five and three years old. Her husband is working in Russia because he could not find a suitable job for himself in Tajikistan. 

Shahnoza lives in the city with her father, mother, sister, brothers and children. She offers tailoring services from home. Shahnoza has sewed clothes for a living for four and a half years. She likes the daily income from her job. However, she hs not been able to save money to renovate her home.

Shahnoza has applied for a loan in order to renovate her home. With the loan she will buy building materials, and with the remainder of the money she will pay for the services of a professional.

loans.use: to renovate her home and pay for the services of a professional

loans.name: Norbi

texts.ru: Норби 53 лет. Она  из района Шахритус. Норби замужем и у нее один единственный сын. Мужу 53 лет. Норби счастливая мать и бабушка.  Сын женат и имеет детей. Сыну 29 лет, и невестке 25 лет. Сын занимается ремонтом домов на районе. Норби трудолюбивая женщина. Она дома печет хлеб.  Норби печет вкусный и традиционный хлеб. Ее муж помогает ей продать хлеб на рынке. У нее имеется много клиентов. Ее хлеб хорошо известен и знаменит своими вкусами и запахами. Норби решила отремонтировать свой дом. Ей нужна определенная сумма денег для купли стройматериалы, и ремонтировать дом. Она хочет улучшить условия жизни семьи и жить комфортно как другие жители района. Норби верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Norbi is 53 years old. She comes from the Shahrituz area. Norbi is married and has an only son. Her husband is 53 years old. 
Norbi is happy mother and also a grandmother. Her son is married and has children. He is 29 years and his wife is 25. Norbi's son does the house repairs in the area. Norbi is a hardworking woman. She bakes delicious and traditional bread at home. Her husband helps her sell bread in the market. They have a lot of customers, as Norbi's bread is well known and popular for its taste and smell. 
Norbi has decided to renovate her house. She needs a certain amount of money to purchase building materials and repair the house. She wants to improve the living conditions of her family and live comfortably like the other residents of the area. Norbi believes in you and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.ru:
Рахбар трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина 46 лет. Она родилась и выросла в семье рабочего. Рахбар замужем и имеет 4х детей. Супруги живут не богато, но счастливо. Рахбар занимается куплей продажей на базаре. Она продает чулочно носочные изделия. Каждый день без выходных она трудится чтобы заработать на жизнь. Её муж работает разнорабочим на стройке. 
 В данное время она хочет получить кредит на расширение своего бизнеса. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahbar is a 46 year-old hardworking and cheerful woman. She was born and raised in a working class family. Rahbar is married and has 4 children. The couple doesn't  live lavishly, however they are happy. 
Rahbar is engaged in purchase and sale at the market. She sells hosiery. Every day, without holidays, Rahbar works to make a living. Her husband is a laborer on a construction site. 
At this time, Rahbar wants to get a loan to expand her business. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
Рахима  трудолюбивая женщина 46 леn. Она родилась и выросла в семье дехкан. Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Они живут дружно в доме котjрый построили сами. Рахима занимается животноводством и земледелием.Она арендует 2 га земли, на котором выращивает зерно и овощи. Также дополнительным доходом для её семьи является животноводство. У неё имеется несколько голов скота, которых она выращивает для дальнейшей продажи.
 Но сейчас Рахима хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у неё недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Рахима очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahima is a hardworking woman 46 years of age. She was born and raised in a family of farmers. She is married and has four children. They live together in a house which they built themselves. 

Rahima works in animal husbandry and farming. She rents two hectares of land, on which she cultivates grain and vegetables. Animal husbandry provides a source of additional income for her family. She has some cattle which she is raising in order to sell them in the future.

However, now Rahima wants to expand her business, particularly her crop cultivation. But now she does not have enough funds in order to purchase seeds for planting crops. Thus she has turned to Arvand, and wants to take a loan in order to purchase seeds for planting crops. Rahima hopes very much for a favourable outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a multifunctional sewing machine.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, es una persona muy sacrificada, que pone todo de si para poder crecer y salir adelante, quiere ser una buena profesional, es por ello que pone todo de su para poder crecer y salir adelante. Comenta que su anterior  prestamos le fue de mucha ayuda, y pudo cubrir los gastos que tenia.
Ahora pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de tesis y con ello cubrir ese grande gasto que tiene. agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Nancy is studying for a degree in nursing and is a very self-sacrificing person who puts her whole self into being able to grow and get ahead. She wants to be a good professional. For this reason, she puts her whole self into being able to grow and get ahead. She says that her previous loans were a great help and she could cover the expenses that she had. 

Now she asks for another loan to pay the expenses of her thesis and with this to cover this big expense that she has. She is grateful for this new opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of her thesis.

loans.name: Celino

texts.es:
Celino es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, viene  de una familia humilde, comenta que terminó sus estudios del colegio y se mudó para poder seguir estudiando para ser alguien en la vida e ir mejorando.
Está estudiando la licenciatura en educación inicial, y con ello quiere poder ser un buen maestro y ayudar a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de universidad, como transporte y alimentación. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Celino is from the city of Caaguazú, he comes from a humble family. He says that he finished his education at the secondary school and moved to be able to continue studying to be someone in his life and continue improving.

He is studying for a degree in primary education and with that he wants to be able to be a good teacher and help people.

He asks for this loan to be able to cover his university expenses such as transportation and food. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is getting to be able to improve.

loans.use: to pay university expenses.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jugos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de jugos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papayas, uvas, manzanas y naranjas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues working at her juice business. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who through this business wants to get her family ahead. Her dream is to expand her juice business. She asks for the loan to purchase papayas, grapes, apples, and oranges.

This borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase papayas, grapes, apples, and oranges.

loans.name: Nuvia

texts.es:
Nuvia es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, el a la par que estudia también trabaja y pone todo su esfuerzo para poder salir adelante.
Ella está saliendo adelante por medio de su sacrificio y su esfuerzo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus carreras, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Nuvia is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She is studying for a law degree and while she is going to school, she also works and she puts all her effort into being able to get ahead.

She is getting ahead through her sacrifice and efforts. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be someone in life.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her studies and with that be able to continue with her education as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university expenses.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues working at her grocery store and restaurant. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. Through this business she wants to get ahead. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Ambar Bibi

texts.es:
La socia Ambar Bibi  se sigue dedica al negocio de turismo,la socia vende boletos turísticos a las diferentes personas del extranjero y también personas nacionales,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de boletos turisticos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ambar Bibi continues working in tourism. She sells tourist tickets to people from abroad and also from within the country. She is an enterprising woman and through this business, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand the business selling tourist tickets. She asks for the loan to purchase tourist tickets.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase tourist tickets.

loans.name: Donathe

texts.en:
Donathe, is 38 years old. She is married and has five children between 4 and 15 years old. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past six years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for growing maize.

loans.name: Drocele

texts.en:
Drocele is 52 years old. She is married and has six children, 16 to 29 years old. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past seven years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to improve her family's welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for growing maize.

With the loan from Kiva, she would to buy more cows for rearing. The buyer is the one who's hand is up, and the seller is standing near the cow.

The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Ngoan

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoan is a hardworking woman, 39 years old. She lives with her husband and three children. She would like to improve her living standard. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from fishing and a small business.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 30, is married and has two children, 3 and 6. One of them goes to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been in business for the past four years. Her husband is a businessman. She is the buyer with her hand up in the photo; the man is the seller.

loans.name: Amos

texts.es:
El socio Amos se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas, espejos y parabrisas para carros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Amos continues working in his auto spare part business. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. He has already 5 years in this business and it goes very well. His dream is to expand the business of auto spare parts. He is asking for a loan to buy tires, mirrors, and windshield wipers for cars. He is happy with the loan and he is committed to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To buy tires, mirrors, and windshield wipers for cars.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Belie

texts.en:
Belie is 49 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of 13 and 25 years old. The children all go to school. 

Belie is a farmer and she has been in business for the past six years. Her husband is also a farmer. Belie is the one in the photo whose hand is raised; the other person is a seller. loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy está cursando la Carrera de Ciencias en Farmacias, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora estudia y trabaja para ayudarle a su familia.
Ella es muy dedicada a sus estudios y comenta que su sueño es de poder culminar sus estudios tener un título universitario para poder trabajar y enseñar en las Universidades. 
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de la universidad y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Nancy is studying in the Science Program - Pharmacy. She is very responsible, honest, and hard working. She works and studies to help her family. She is fully dedicated to her studies, and stated that her dream is to be able to finish her studies,  have a college degree, and be able to work and teach in universities. She is requesting a loan to cover her college costs, thus to be able to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: To pay her college costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Evany

texts.es:
Evany es de la ciudad de Pilar, comenta que desea superarse cada día más y en el futuro ser una excelente profesional y poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante, es por ello que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Evany is from the city of Pilar.  She comments that she wants to improve herself every day and in the future to be an excellent professional and be able to help other people.  She is putting forth all of herself in order to grow and get ahead.  This is why she is putting forth her best efforts.

She is asking for a loan in order to cover the costs of her degree program.  In this way she will be able to continue studying as she has been doing.  She is thankful for this opportunity to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: To cover university costs.

loans.name: Alcatraces Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Veracruz hay un pequeño poblado habitado por gente amable y muy trabajadora cuya principal actividad se basa en el campo. El grupo Alcatraces está conformado por doce habitantes de dicho poblado, ellas son: María, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos; Calixta, Eufrosina, Irma y Carmen, a la venta de antojitos; Flavia, al servicio de taller mecánico; Zobeida, a la venta de productos para el hogar y cría de cerdos; Margarita, Gloria, Andrea y Lucía, a la venta de ropa y Paula, a la venta de abarrotes. 

Irma es madre soltera por lo que ha tenido que enfrentar el reto de hacerse cargo de sus tres hijos, una joven de veinte años y dos pequeños de diez y cinco años, respectivamente. Desde hace tres años, Irma comenzó a vender antojitos mexicanos. Al principio, sólo contaba con un anafre, tres mesitas y una lona que la cubría del sol y la lluvia. Posteriormente, y con el apoyo de su mamá e hija, Irma pudo adquirir un estanquillo (casa de lámina), tres mesas nuevas, sillas; y ahora tiene más y mejores lonas para ofrecer un mejor servicio. 

   La vida de Irma es muy activa: “por la mañana soy ama de casa y a partir de las 6:00 pm y hasta las 11:00 pm soy comerciante los siete días de la semana, horario  en que vendo los antojitos en el parque de la comunidad”. Trabajar arduamente le ha permitido dar estudio a sus hijos además de adquirir electrodomésticos para su hogar.

   Con la oportunidad del préstamo, Doña Irma podrá invertir en la compra de láminas tubulares, peinazos y birlos; materiales con los que pretende construir un nuevo techo para que su clientela esté más cómoda mientras disfruta sus sabrosos antojitos. 

   El grupo Alcatraces agradece a todos aquellos que han hecho posible tener la oportunidad de recibir los préstamos para lograr que sus actividades den mayores frutos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en una de las calles del poblado, frente a la casa de doña Mari, Irma viste blusa color rosa y mandil rojo.
texts.en: In the state of Veracruz there is a small village populated by kind and hardworking people whose main activity is in the field. The Alcatraces group is formed by 12 inhabitants from this village. They are: Maria, who works selling clothing and cosmetic; Calixta, Eufrosina, Irma, and Carmen, who sell typical Mexican snacks; Flavia, who has a car repair shop; Zobeida, who sells housewares and raises pigs; Margarita, Gloria, Andrea, and Lucia, who sell clothing; and Paula, who runs a grocery store. Irma is a single mother who has been challenged with raising her three children, a young lady age 20 years old, and two small children ages 10 and 5, respectively. For the past three years, Irma began to sell typical Mexican snacks. At the beginning, she only had a small grill, three tables, and a tarp to protect the area from sun and rain. Later, and with her mother and daughter's help, Irma was able to buy a small stand (metallic frame,) 3 small tables,chairs, and she has more tarps to offer a better service. Irma's life is very active: "in the morning, I am a housewife, and from 6:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m. I work seven days a week selling Mexican snacks at the community park." Working hard has allowed her to provide education for her children and to buy appliances for her house. With the opportunity of this loan, Irma will be able to invest in metallic sheets, tubulars, rails and bolts. She will use these materials to build a new roof so that her clients can be more comfortable as they enjoy their flavorful snacks. The Alcatraces group thanks all of those who have made this opportunity possible of obtaining loans to ensure that their activities bear greater results.     *The picture was taken in one of the town's streets, in front of Mrs. Mari's house. Irma wears a rose colored blouse and a red apron.

loans.use: To buy metallic sheets, tubulars, rails and bolts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un joven soltero de 32 años de edad, necesita a cirugía llamada autoplastia esto debido a que encontraron un crecimiento benigno en su ojo izquierdo que sobresale de la conjuntiva y lentamente ha avanzado hasta la cornea por lo cual tiene visión borrosa su primer opción fue optar por unos lentes para que le ayudaran  es imposible debido a que este tumor ya empieza a causar dolor. Este padecimiento afecta mucho en su trabajo.
texts.en: This young man is 32 years old and single.  He needs a surgery called ‘autoplastia’ because they found a benign growth on his left eye.  The growth protrudes from the conjunctiva.  It has slowly moved to the cornea.  Because of this, he has blurry vision.  His first option was to use glasses to help, but it is impossible because the tumor is now starting to be painful.  This condition is greatly affecting his work.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

В данное время Хурсандчон хочет приобрести новую швейную машину, чтобы расширить свое дело. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.

She is a very cheerful and loving mother. She lives happily with her family. At this time, Hursandjon wants to buy a new sewing machine in order to expand her business. She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

texts.ru: Гулбахору 40 лет. Она жевет в городе Душанбе. Гулбахор замужем и  у нее двое Сыновей. Далер и Довуд. Ее муж занимается таксистом в городе. Гулбахор серьезная и активная женщина. Она после окончания школы начала заняться шитьем женской одежды. У нее 10 летный опыт работы. Гулбахор профессионал своей работы. В швейном  деле ей нравится ежедневный доход и общение с новыми клиентами. Гулбахор хотела купить швейные принадлежности и взять ученика, чтобы расширить деятельность. Но у нее возникли проблемы с деньгами. Она не смогла приобрести швейные принадлежности. Сейчас она решила, взят кредит и расширения деятельность. Путем расширения деятельности увеличиться ежедневный доход. Гулбахор с большими надеждами обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать ее!
texts.en: Gulbahor is 40 years old. She lives in the city of Dushanbe. Gulbahor is married and she has two sons, Daler and Dovud. Her husband works as a taxi driver in the city. Gulbahor is a serious and active woman. On finishing school she began sewing women's clothes. She has ten years of work experience. Gulbahor is a professional in her work. What she likes about sewing is having daily income and talking to new clients. Gulbahor would like to buy sewing supplies and take on a student in order to expand her business, but problems have arisen with money. She was not able to buy the sewing supplies. Now she has decided to take a loan and expand her business. By expanding her business her daily income will increase. Gulbahor turns to you with high hopes for a loan. You can support her!

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and expand her business..

loans.name: Noemi Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Noemi Ruth se dedica al negocio de pasamaneria,la socia vende jaboncillos,papeles higienicos,shampos y pasadores,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pasamaneria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar jaboncillos,papeles higienicos,shampos y pasadores.

She has several years of experience in this business and it is going very well.  Her dream is to grow her business. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase soaps, paper, shampoos, hair clips, and other items.  

She is happy about this loan and promised to comply with all repayment quotas.

She finally managed another pregnancy, which is high risk.  This made her quit her job.  Her husband has a job, but he earns very little.  Therefore the examination and delivery expenses are expensive for her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to pay for childbirth.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene is 28 years old. She is married with two children, who are two and four years old and do not yet go to school. 

Helene is a farmer and she has been in business for the past four years, while her husband is a businessman. She is the one whose hand is up, and the other person is a seller. 

With the loan from Kiva, Helene would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.ru:
Зарнигор молодая девушка  21 лет. Она родилась и выросла в семье рабочего. Зарнигор  учится в третьем  курсе заочного отделения . Зарнигор работает в МДО ХУМО кредитным экспертом.  Она живет с родителями. У неё очень дружная семья.  
Зарнигор  обратилась в Арванд, где узнала что есть возможность получить кредит на образование. Она желает получить кредит для оплаты своего обучения. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Zarnigor is a young 21-year-old woman. She was born and raised in a working class family. Zarnigor is a third-year distance learning student. Zarnigor works for the Humo Microfinance Institution as a credit expert. She lives with her parents. She has a very close-knit family. Zarnigor has turned to Arvand where she has learned that it is possible to get a loan for education. She wants to take a loan to pay for her tuition. She is very hopeful of a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its financial support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es estudiante  de medicina, es madre soltera y comenta que su meta es terminar su carrera, ayudar a sus padres y cuidar de ellos. 
Sueña con montar su consultorio en su barrio para ayudar a la gente de su comunidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder cumplir con las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a medical student and a single mother.  She says that her goal is to finish her university studies, and to help and care for her parents.  Her dream is to set up a doctor's office in her neighborhood in order to help the people of her community.

She asks for this loan to be able to cover the costs of her studies and with this be able to continue her education as she has been doing.  She is grateful for receiving the opportunity to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de helados, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajdora,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de helados. La socia solicita el crédito insumos para preparar los helados como azúcar y frutas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Karina still has her business selling ice cream, she is very enterprising and hardworking. Her dream is to grow her business selling ice cream. Karina is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for her ice creams such as sugar and fruit. She is very happy to have this opportunity to get a loan and promises to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making ice cream such as sugar and fruits.

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Сайёра и ей 28 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Сайёра вместе с семьей проживает в маленком городке под названием Турсунзаде. Город был назван в честь великого писателя современника Мирзо Турсунзаде. Сайёра домохозяйка. Она следит за детьми и домашними делами. Ее муж на данный момент безработный. Он помогает супруге в делах. 
   Сайёра уже много лет во дворе имеет скотин. Она с самого раннего детства помогала родителям в работе на скотном дворе и в доме мужа начала животноводческую деятельность. Так как на данный момент семейные положение семьи не самые лучшие и ее муж не может найти работу, они приняли решение развивать животноводческую деятельность и увеличить доход. Она намерена обратиться за кредитом и купить пару голов скотин. Она будет Вам благодарна за Вашу поддержку в трудную минуту.
texts.en: This is Sayyora and she is 28 years old. She is married and has three children. Sayyora lives with her family in a small town called Tursun-zoda. The town was named in honor of the great modern writer Mirzo Tursunzoda. Sayyora is a housewife. She looks after the children and household matters. Her husband is currently unemployed. He helps his wife in her affairs. For many years Sayyora has been keeping livestock in her yard. She helped her parents to work in their livestock yard since early childhood, and started rearing animals at her husband's home. Since her family's circumstances are not the best at the moment and her husband cannot find work, they have decided to develop their livestock business and increase their income. She intends to apply for a loan and to buy a couple of heads of livestock. She will be grateful to you for your support at a difficult time.

loans.use: to buy a few heads of livestock.

loans.use: to invest in cables, screws, a fuse box, and wire to install electricity in his shed

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, aged 33 years, is married with two children aged 4 and 7 years. They both go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 11 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare, pay school fees for her children, and to buy a cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as opportunistic. She operates a retail business where she sells fish and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 52 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 9 and 25 years old -- they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been in a business for the past 11 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to pay his children's school fees and to improve his standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For these reasons, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of firewood and vegetables.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 48 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 7 and 25 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 11 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet is a married man. He has 1 child. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, coconuts, paraffin, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, coconuts, paraffin, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, coconuts, paraffin ,and other items

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, aged 49 years, is married with three children aged between 8 and 17 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 12 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare, to pay school fees for her children, and to renovate her house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Kicheche Tukore Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Jane is a hard-working female who is married and living in Kamwenge, Uganda. For 9 years, Jane has been running a retail shop that sells general merchandise. She began the business to support her family. Jane’s dream is growing her business and educating her children. However, she is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations. 

Jane wants money to buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and has 5 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Florence is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Florence started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to the best seed prices. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Florence’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Ba Gan Chaung Village - Group 2

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Ba Gan Chaung group-2, named (from left to right) Thein, Jar, Margaret, Wa and Than. 

The Featured Borrower, Than, has a 5 acre farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, income is very low before the harvest season. Than is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of four (two children), who are in 8th grade and 10th grade. Part of the family’s income goes towards funding the children’s education. Than and her family hopes for further education for their children, and be the first ones in the family to go to university.

The fund will help 31 borrowers in the village. The CBO leaders oversee this group, and they will purchase farming essentials and labor needed for harvest time with this loan.  Ba Gan Chaung Village mainly focus on crop farming, and other seasonal foods. They also do plantation such as palm trees, coconut trees, for additional income.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment, and hire farm staff during harvest time.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Philip, who has been a farmer for 20 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. Philip has always been described as a very trustworthy person, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

Philip started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2012, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs but also a solar light as part of his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He can’t wait to send his children to school using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

Philip’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jacton's Group

texts.en:
Jacton's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Jacton, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 57 years old, is married and has 4 children. Jacton has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Jacton isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Jacton will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Jacton's Group will purchase a total of 4 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
Ben is a 58-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ben has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Ben described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Ben’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Tike Chaung Village - Group 2

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Tike Chaung group-2, named (from left to right) Kyaing, Than, Maung, Win and Kyi. 

The Featured Borrower, Kyi, has a 3 acre farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, income is very low before harvest season.  The loan will help her purchase the necessary farming resources she needs to harvest her crops.  Kyi is 42 years old, married, and supports a family of seven (five children), the youngest of whom is in 3th grade. Part of the family’s income goes towards funding the children's education. Kyi and her family hope to expand her business as buying more paddy fields and plantation fields.

The fund will help a total of 22 borrowers in the village. The CBO leaders oversee this group, and they will purchase farming essentials and labor needed for harvest time with this loan.  Tike Chaung group-2 Village mainly focus on crop farming and as well as seasonal foods.They also do plantation such as flowers and banana trees, for additional income.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment, and hire farm staff during harvest time.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru:
Фарзона молодая женщина из района Хамадони. Ей 22 года. Она занимается кулей и продажей крупнорогатых скотов. Сейчас у нее дома имеется 1 крупнорогатый скот. Фарзона с помощью кредита намерена закупить несколько голов скотов и расширить деятельность. Ей будут помогать ее семья. Она замужем имеет маленького сыночка. 
  Фарзона будет держать своих бычков, телят и коров на скотном дворе при наступлении зимы, они будут жить в коровнике. Фарзона целеустремленная женщина надеемся, что ее ждет удача.
texts.en:
Farzona is a young woman from the Hamadoni region. She is 22 years old. She is involved in trading cattle. Currently at home she has one steer. With the help of a loan, Farzona intends to buy several head of cattle and to expand activities. She will help her family. She is married and has a small son.

Farzona will keep her steers, calf and cow in a cattle barn at the approach of winter. They will live in a small cow shed. Farzona is a purposeful woman and we hope that she will be fortunate.

loans.use: to buy some steer and calves.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
Реализовать свою мечту и добиться поставленной цели, каждому дано. Если у человека есть талант, данный свыше, то не каждый может развивать его в правильном направлении. Это история о девушке на фотографии, оделенная большим талантом. Ее зовут Насиба. Ей 22 года. Насиба росла в большой семье. Она в одном доме живет вместе с родителями, двумя братьями и их женами, детьми. В отличие от сверстников Насиба твердо знала, кем она будет в будущем. Бог наградил ее прекрасным слухом и неповторимым голосом. Она с самого детства пела, танцевала и мечтала стать великой певицей. Ее родители поддерживают ее как могут, но в маленьком провинциальном городке Дж.Руми, ей не удастся добиться высоких целей. Сейчас Насиба работает в музыкальной школе, где сама, когда то училась. 
   Насиба поставила себе цель, и она будет верно идти к нему. Она станет певицей! Чтобы осуществить свою мечту и начать музыкальную карьеру, ей нужны средства. Она приобретет музыкальные инструменты, создаст группу музыкантов и снимет клип. Она верит, что рано или поздно ее заметят, и она поймает свою звезду успеха.
texts.en: Not everyone can realize their dream and achieve their goal. Even if a person has a talent given from above, not everyone can develop it in the right direction. This is the story of the girl in the photograph to whom has been given a big talent. She is called Nasiba and she is 22 years old. Nasiba grew up in a large family. She lives in one house with her parents, two brothers, and their wives and children. Unlike her peers, Nasiba has always known clearly what she will be in the future. God has granted her a wonderful ear and unique voice. Ever since her childhood she has sung, danced and dreamed of becoming a great singer. Her parents support her how they can, but in the small provincial town of J. Rumy she will not be able to achieve her high aims. Now Nasiba works in the same music school where she once studied herself. Nasiba has set herself a goal, and she is going to pursue it faithfully. She will become a singer! She needs funds to realize her dream and begin a career in music. She is going to buy musical instruments, form a group of musicians, and record a video. She believes that she will be noticed sooner or later, and she will catch her star of success.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments and record a music video.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Peninah's business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought. 

Peninah will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production. Her business goal is to be an important supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to meet the milk supply demands of customers.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a single woman. She has 2 children. She operates a beauty salon. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be water shortages. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more water to sell. His business goal is to open another business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 60-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Beatrice has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Beatrice described her harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Beatrice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en:
James is 76 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

James has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. James also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan. He is very excited about it, as it will allow him to reduce their consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that James's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Annah, who has been a farmer for 15 years. Although she is pictured alone, she is actually representing her group of 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. Annah has always been described as a very hardworking individual, which is largely why she was selected to be the group leader.

Annah started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2012, and this year she decided to not only get farming inputs but also two solar lights as part of her loan. She is very excited about this new addition, as now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. She can’t wait to send her children to school using the profits she earns from this coming season. 

Annah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 43 years old. He is married with five children aged 8 and 17 years; they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been in this business for the past 11 years. His wife is a business woman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece land for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: 031411010004.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Minh operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is applying for a loan to purchase fishing net to catch fish to sell.  

Minh is 56 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 031411010004.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Minh lives with no dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Minh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets to catch fish to sell.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
Шаходат 55 летняя жительница района Гафуров. Она бизнес – леди. Шаходат в родном районе живет вместе мужем и детьми. У нее небольшая семья. Шаходат добрая, счастливая мама и бабушка.  Сыновья женаты и имеют детей. Ее муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности.
Шаходат на рынке продает рис. Она любить заниматься таким видом бизнеса. Еей на работе помогает сыновья. Шаходат собирается, привозит больше мешков, и запасти рис для продаже.  По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Ее деятельность является основной, потому что доход от продажи обеспечить семью. Шаходат заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Shahodat is a 55-year-old resident of the Gafurov region. She is a businesswoman. Shahodat lives in her native region with her husband and children. She has a small family. Shahodat is a kind, happy mother and grandmother. Her sons are married and have children. Her husband is involved in agricultural activities.

Shahodat sells rice at a market. She likes to be involved in this type of business. Her sons her help in this work. Shahodat is going to transport more bags (of rice) and to stock up for sales. For this reason, she applied for a loan. Her activity is vital because income from sales supports the family. Shahodat expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to transport large bags of rice and to stock up for sales.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 33 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 9 and 17 years; they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been in this business for the past 10 years. His wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to improve his standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Gladys Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Gladys, often described as an extremely friendly person. She is 45 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.  She is married and has 3 children.

Gladys is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Gladys says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Gladys will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia, age 34, is a married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She deals in the business of cattle with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase another buffalo to increase her earnings to better support the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Leonida's Group

texts.en:
Leonida is a 57-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Leonida has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Leonida described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Leonida’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gull

texts.en:
At the age of 38, Gull sells goats. She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures. 

For the improvement of her business, Gull has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more goats to resell in the market for profit to provide a better standard of living for her family members. 

She is shown in the photo with her brother-in-law.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell in the market at profit

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar, 36 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Gulzar  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and so she can have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices.

loans.name: Sagheran

texts.en:
Sagheran is 46 years old, a married woman who has been doing a business purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 5 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Rebecca, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 31 years old, is married and has 4 children. Rebecca has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Rebecca isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Rebecca will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Rebecca's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 40 years old, a married woman. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is shown in the photo with her father. Over time she attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more stocks of grains, biscuits and cleaning products so she can cater to more customers to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grains, biscuits and cleaning products to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: 36 летняя женщина Рано. Она жительница района Чиликул. Рано замужняя женщина. У нее один сын и одна дочка. Дочка ходит в школу. Сын еще маленький. Муж занимается ремонтом домов на районе. Рано занимается животноводством у себя дома. Животноводческая деятельность основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Рано обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количества скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовья скота ей нужно деньги для купли мелко рогатого скотов и сохранить деятельность.
texts.en:
This 36 year old woman is Rano. She is a resident of the Jilikul region. Rano is a married woman. She has a son and a daughter. Her daughter goes to school and the son is small. Her husband works with renovating homes in the region. Rano works with livestock breeding at her home.

The livestock breeding business is important, because the income from it helps provide for the family. Rano applied for a loan because she has few heads of cattle left. To keep her business and increase the number of livestock, she needs money for purchasing sheep and goats.

loans.use: to increase the number of livestock and keep her business

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Нозигул  26 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Ее дети еще маленькие. Нозигул вместе семьей живет на районе Кубадиен. Она шустрая и ответственная женщина. Нозигул 2 года своей жизни продвигает торговую деятельность.  Она  занимается продажей детской одежды и ткани на рынке. Ее доходы от этой деятельностью. Ей на работе помогает муж. Нозигул просит кредит для перевоза детских одежды и ткани для продажи. Она решила расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Нозигул надеется с увеличением товара, увеличиться доход и может улучшить условия жизни детей и семью.
texts.en:
Nozigul is 26 years old. She is married and has children, who are still small. Nozigul lives with her family in the Kubadien region. She is a clever and responsible woman.

Nozigul has spent two years of her life promoting trade. She is engaged in selling children's clothing and fabric at a market. Her income comes from this activity. Her husband helps her in this work. Nozigul is requesting a loan for transportation of children's clothes and fabrics to sell. She decided to expand activities and to expand her inventory.

Nozigul hopes with more inventory to increase income and to be able to improve living conditions for her children and family.

loans.use: to transport children's clothing and fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Gulbutamo

texts.ru: Гулбутамо та женщина, с которой хочется долго общаться. Она очень добрая, гостеприимная и приятная женщина. Трудно встретишь такого человека с большим сердцем и чистой душой.
