Гулбутамо замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее дочка работает медсестрой. Она любит помогать людям и выбрала эту деятельность. Гулбутамо поддерживает свою дочь, ведь она делает добрые дела, помогает людям и приносит пользу обществу. Гулбутамо выбрала иную деятельность. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. От своей работы она получает удовольствие. Ей нравиться шить, кроить и видеть, как клиентки оценивают ее работу. Гулбутамо просит ей помочь купить новую швейную машинку. Машинка, которая у нее есть, она не профессиональная и не поддерживает темп ее работы. Она хочет купить швейную машинку, которая поможет ей. Гулбутамо заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en:
Gulbutamo is a woman with whom one would like to talk for a long time. She is a very kind, hospitable, and pleasant woman. It is difficult to find such a person with a big heart and pure soul.

Gulbutamo is married. She has two children. Her daughter works as a nurse, since she loves to help people and chose this trade. Gulbutamo supports her daughter, because she does good work, helps people and benefits society.

Gulbutamo chose another activity. She is involved in sewing women's clothing. From her work, she gets pleasure. She likes to cut and sew, and to see how customers value her work. Gulbutamo is requesting help to purchase a new sewing machine. The machine which she has is not professional and does not maintain the pace of her work. She wants to buy a sewing machine which will help her. Gulbutamo gives her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Bibisora

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Бибисора. Ей 49 лет. Она имеет троих детей. У нее двое сыновей и одна дочка. Бибисора живет вместе семьей в районе Н.Хусрав. Старший сын после смерти отца, находится на заработках Российской Федерации, чтобы заработать и помочь маме обеспечить семью. Младший сын учится в средней школе. Невестка домохозяйка, она ведет домашнее хозяйство и помогает маме. 
Бибисора серьезная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она у себя во дворе занимается животноводством. Бибисора хочет начать новый бизнес, чтобы заработать и улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она решила заниматься продажей детских одежды и игрушки на рынке. Бибисора просит кредит для перевоза детских одежды и игрушки для продажи. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Ваш кредит поможет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
This woman is called Bibisora. She is 49 years old and has three children. She has two sons and one daughter. Bibisora lives in the N. Khusrav region together with her family. 

After the death of his father, her eldest son went to the Russian Federation as a migrant worker, in order to earn money and help his mother provide for the family. The youngest son goes to high school. Bibisora's daughter-in-law is a housewife. She manages the household and helps Bibisora. 

Bibisora is a earnest and hard-working woman. She works with livestock breeding in her yard. She would like to start a new business in order to earn money and improve the family's living conditions. She decided to work with selling children's clothing and toys at the market. 

Bibisora requests a loan to bring in children's clothing and toys for selling. She believes in you and your support. Your loan will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: to bring in children's clothing and toys for selling

loans.name: Abakora Hamwe Group Kyamalaya

texts.en:
Meresi is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children, who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a member of a village bank where they guarantee one another to get a loan. She sells fresh foods like tomatoes, yellow bananas, matooke (cooking bananas), greens, and Irish potatoes. She started with capital from savings in their group and group loans. She has low capital to buy a variety of fresh foods that are mainly affected by being perishable. 

Meresi is requesting a loan to buy more fresh foods like yellow banana to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods like yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela raises and sells hogs as her main source of income. She  is 50 years old, a  married woman with three children ages 12 to 10, residing in  Mayorga, Leyte. She has been raising hogs for almost 10 years. Her husband is a carpenter. His income is of great help for the family's daily needs.

Estella  is asking for a loan to purchase pig feed and pig supplements. These are very helpful in growing her hog raising business. In the coming months, she could now raise and sell healthy hogs. Thus, she could now start to settle her obligations and balance her finances. She could now provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

In the future, Estela  dreams of expanding her business to make it successful and sustainable as well.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en:
Peluce is a 46-year-old widow with eight children, four of whom attend school. 

She has been in the agriculture business for more than twenty years and out of agriculture she has managed to build rentals houses where she earns additional income. 

Peluce started the business to generate income and wants money to buy Iron sheets to roof some rentals houses. Peluce still faces a challenge of tenants not paying on time.

loans.use: to buy Iron sheets to roof some rentals  houses

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en:
James, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Matete District. He is 54 years old, is married and has seven children.

James likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. James plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, James’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya  is 47 years old, married and has run a business of selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her neighborhood.  Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 6 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now, she requests for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales.  she hopes she will earn agood amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales

loans.name: Kiseveni Women Group

texts.en:
Sela raising her hand in the photo is a member of Kiseveni Women group. She is 66 years of age and a mother of 12 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 with an aim of improving her skills in enterprise development.

She is involved in selling ballasts.  She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more ballasts hence increase stock to her business to be able to meet her customers' needs. 

She appreciates KIVA and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more ballasts for her business

loans.name: Netty's Group

texts.en:
Netty is a 50-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Netty has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Netty described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce their consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Netty’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Ее зовут Матлуба. Она живет на районе Чиликул и ей 53 лет. Матлуба добрая и приятная  общение женщина. Она проживает вместе мужем и  сыновьям.  Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине, что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Матлуба работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподавательница русского языка. Матлуба любит детей и выбрала себе эту работу. Она продвигает эту работу уже 5 лет. Матлуба обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет закончить ремонт. Она сумела отремонтировать всего одно комнату, остальные комнаты дома остаются без ремонта, и Матлуба  хочется получить кредит и за счет кредита отремонтировать остальные комнаты. На счет заемных средств, она намерена приобрести стройматериалы.  Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей завершить ремонт.
texts.en:
This is Matluba. She lives in the Jilikul region and is 53 years old. Matluba is a good and pleasant woman. She lives together with her husband and sons. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation because he couldn't find a suitable job in his own country. 

Matluba works as a high school teacher. She teaches Russian language. Matluba loves the children and chose this profession herself. She has worked with this for five years. 

Matluba applied for a loan because she would like to finish the renovation of her home. She only managed to renovate one room. The remaining ones are left without renovation, and therefore she would like to get a loan and use this to renovate the remaining rooms. She intends to purchase building materials for the loan amount. The loan will help her finish the renovation.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and complete the renovation of her home

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Бактыгул- средне-специальное образование. Занимается продажей продуктов питания и овощей уже 5 лет. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение средств в обороте. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса
texts.en:
Baktygul is 45 years old, married, and has two children with her husband. Baktygul has vocational education. She has worked with selling food products and vegetables for 5 years. Thanks to her persistent work, the monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Baktygul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to increase her turnover. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further strengthening her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for reselling

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru: Мафтуна, 35 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мафтуны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы. На 0,72 Га земли выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). Мафтуна входит в группу "Толкун", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека, Мафтуна является лидером. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мафтуна обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян картофеля и хлопка, часть средств потратит на покупку коров для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Мафтуна планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома
texts.en: Maftuna is 35 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to Maftuna's hard work, today her farm contains 4 cows. She also grows potatoes and corn on 0.72 hectares of land. Her monthly income amounts to about 18,000 som (KGS). Maftuna is a member of the Tolkun group that includes two more people. Maftuna is the leader of this group. To continue developing her business, Maftuna requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers, potato and cotton seeds and to buy cows for fattening up. Maftuna plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and saving money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, potato and cotton seeds and to buy cows for fattening up

loans.name: Jothan's Group

texts.en:
Jothan is 43 years old and has 6 children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Jothan is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Jothan started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Jothan’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 36 years old, a widow and is running a small general store in her community,which she has been doing for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who shop regularly at her store. Sajida makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stockher store, she requests a loan of 40000 PKR to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates. This way she would be able to meet her increasing demand consistently. 

Sajida wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is 46 years old and has 7 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Violet is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Violet started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Violet’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Agnes Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old and has 7 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Agnes is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Agnes started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Agnes’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Matete District. She is 32 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Mary likes to think of herself as a very friendly person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to save more money. Mary plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Mary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Umaru.  He is married and has 5 children aged 22, 18, 16, 12 and 9.  

In 2012, Umaru established his provisions shop.  He began his business just to develop himself and his family.  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,357,200 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Umaru has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional provisions like bags of sugar, cartons of milk, mayonnaise, butter and sardines etc..  

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits and to improve on his business. In the future, Umaru still plans to improve on his business to educate his children and to build a house.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of milk, mayonnaise, bags of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow  to increase the supply of milk for more income

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 28 years old, married to Sephah and he supports 4 family members. 

He has been a cyber cafe attendant for the last 5 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which he plans to buy more computers and printers so as to satisfy his customers' demand for internet services, typing and printing services. 

His hopes to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and expand his cyber cafe to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy more computers and printers

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима, 45 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Фотимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы. На 0,20 Га земли выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS). Фотима входит в группу "Толкун", в ней состоят еще 2 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фотима обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита Фотима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Fotima is 45 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to Fotima's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows. She also grows potatoes on 0.20 hectares of land. Her monthly income amounts to about 11,000 som (KGS). Fotima is a member of the Tolkun group that includes 2 more people. To continue developing her business, Fotima requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers and potato seeds. Fotima plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and saving money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds in order to grow organic potatoes

loans.name: Wiston Javier

texts.es:
Lleno de ganas de representar a las personas inocentes y hacer cumplir la justicia, esta Wiston, un joven de veinticuatro años de edad que está en su último año de la licenciatura en derecho. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque desea trabajar en el sistema judicial de Nicaragua y su meta es llegar a ser un importante miembro de este poder del estado. En la actualidad él ya tiene un trabajo con el cual sustenta sus estudios, dado que su madre dejo de apoyarlo. 
En este momento clave de su carrera, Wiston, solicita la ayuda de Kiva junto MiCrédito para que se le brinde un préstamo y con este pueda cancelar su curso de titulación. Con su título ya en sus manos el podrá conseguir mejores oportunidades y desarrollarse profesionalmente como siempre ha soñado. En un par de años el desea emprender un negocio de su propio bufete de abogados.
texts.en:
Full of desire to represent innocent people and carry out justice, Wiston, a 24 year old youth is in this last year of studying Law. He decided to study this profession as he wants to work in the Justice system of Nicaragua. His goal is to become an important member of this power of the state.

Currently he has a job which sustains his studies, as his mother stopped supporting him. At this key moment in his career Wiston is requesting the help of Kiva together with MiCrédito so they award him a loan so he can pay for his courses. With his diploma in his hand he can pursue better employment opportunities and develop professionally as he has always dreamed. In a couple of years he wants to open his own Law firm business.

loans.use: to pay his course tuition.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 35 years old and married, from Kutaisi city, in western Georgia.  She has little daughter and husband, who is a hired driver and gets 500 GEL monthly.  Irine has professional career and works as a stylist at the beauty salon. She has great desire to support her husband's activity financially and herewith increase the living condition of her family. 

Irine requested a loan from local financial institutions and received credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo's - Startup Program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

The family will purchase a truck with the requested amount and Irine's husband will have his own business, particularly transporting cargo for private clients and generating significant income. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a truck and get another source of family income

loans.name: Assinath

texts.en:
Assinath is 60 years old. She is married with 5 children aged 11 and 23 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been in a business for the past 8 years. Her husband is also a farmer. She was in the market, she is the one who raised up her hand. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to increase milk production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул, 22 года, не замужем. У нее среднее образование. В качестве дохода Миргул занимается животноводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Миргул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 12 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Миргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку скота для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Миргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Mirgul is 22 years old and not married. She has secondary education. Mirgul works with livestock breeding to get an income, after having started three years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mirgul's persistent work, her farm currently has two cows, two horses and 12 sheep. The monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Mirgul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase livestock for fattening and subsequently reselling at the market for a higher price. Mirgul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock and in building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia  is a 24-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband assists her by purchasing stock from the market where he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of 2 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficientlyand to boost in her earnings to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela vive con sus padres y hermanos, ella trabaja con su madre en su  copetín y a la vez estudia la carrera de Bioquímica, ella lucha por ser una profesional exitosa que pueda serle útil a las demás personas.
Comenta que está poniendo lo mejor de sí, y que está luchando y poniendo todo de sí para crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Pamela lives with his parents and siblings. She works in her Mother's cafe and at the same time studies Biochemistry. She is striving to become a successful professional who can be useful to other people. She comments that she is doing her utmost, striving and giving her all to grow. She is requesting this loan to pay her tuition so she can continue her studies. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Jennipher

texts.en:
Jennipher is 35 years old, married and supports a family of six members. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 15 years and earns KES 13,000 per month. 

Jennipher has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to increase the milk supply for more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase the milk supply for more income

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Thirty-three year old Bryan hails in Macarthur, Leyte and has an eight-year old son. 

He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells commodities ranging from rice, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasonings and condiments.  He has been running the store for 5 years, but now he is in need of capital to continue operate his store. 

He is asking for a loan in the amount of 40,000 PHP to buy grocery items and soft drinks.  These will help improve the stock and be able to attract more buyers. Thus, enabling him to slowly increase his earnings. I

n this way, he could pay his obligations and could do some expansion. He could also provide his family with healthy diets and better living conditions.

Bryan hopes to improve his business to become sustainable and successful in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and soft drinks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and married with three children, all in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to purchase rice, soft drinks, biscuits, candies, and canned goods.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, biscuits, candies, and canned goods.

loans.name: Renia

texts.en:
Renia is 42 years old. She is married with six children aged between 4 and 14 years. 4 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been in the business for the past 6 years. Her husband is also a farmer. Renia is the one in the picture who is raising her hand. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay school fees of her children and to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old and married with five children, three in school. Julia works very hard to provide for her family.

Julia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and home care products.
 
Julia has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Julia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and home care products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Barasa's Group

texts.en:
Barasa is 40 years old and has seven children. She is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Barasa has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. She described her last harvest as good and believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Barasa also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan. She is very excited about the solar light as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Barasa's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Barnohon

texts.ru: Барнохон, 24 года, замужем, есть дочь. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Барнохон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы. На 0,50 Га земли, где выращивает лук и картофель, есть 20 кур и индюков. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 14,500 сом (KGS). Барнохон входит в группу "Толкун", в ней состоят еще 2 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для продажи экологически чистого молока, также удобрений и семян хлопка. Доходы от кредита Барнохон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Barnohon is 24 years old, married and has a daughter. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in farming. Thanks to Barnohon's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows. She has 0.50 hectares of land, where she grows onions and potatoes, and has 20 chickens and turkeys. Her monthly income amounts to about 14,500 som (KGS). Barnohon is a member of the Tolkun group that includes 2 more people. To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a dairy cow in order to sell ecologically clean milk, and also to buy fertilizers and cotton seeds. Barnohon plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to sell ecologically clean milk, and also to buy fertilizers and cotton seeds

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr:
57 ans, mariée à un agent de sécurité, Juliette est mère de 5 enfants. Ces derniers sont tous déjà mariés et indépendants. Seulement, Juliette a adopté un de ses  petits-enfants.
Auparavant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche. et elle a arrêté en 2000 car elle trouvait qu'elle ne gagnait pas assez.Son salaire ne couvrait même pas les besoins fondamentales de la famille. Depuis, elle décidait d'entrer dans le domaine du commerce. Achat et revente de friperie, spécialement des blousons cuirs était son choix. En plus, elle voulait aider son mari à soutenir la famille. Le prêt va donc être utilisé pour acheter une balle de blouson cuir fripe. La vente va  être prospère car c'est vraiment la bonne période,  l'hiver arrive très bientôt.
Son but est d'épargner davantage car c'était la faille quand elle était salariée.
texts.en:
Juliette is 57 years old, married to a security agent, and a mother of five children, who are married and living on their own. However, she has adopted one of her grandchildren. 

Previously, Juliette worked in a free trade zone. She stopped in 2000 though, because she found that she was not earning enough. Her salary could not cover her family's basic needs.

So, she decided to start working in commerce so she could help her husband support their family. She now buys and sells used clothing, especially leather jackets. 

This loan is going to be used to buy a bale of used leather jackets. Sales will be good, because it is a good time--winter is soon approaching.

Her goal is to save, because she couldn't when she was working [in the free trade zone].

loans.use: to buy used leather jackets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of soft drinks like assorted sodas

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 38 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Juliet has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Juliet also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Juliet's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 61 years and single.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sahondra Lalao

texts.fr:
Sahondra est mariée  et mère de famille. Son mari tient une petite épicerie et ils ont deux adorables enfants de 12 et 10 ans qui vont tous actuellement à l’école.
A 35 ans, Sahondra gère son petit atelier d'imprimerie depuis 2001.Avant cette année, elle y travaillait déjà mais en tant qu'employé. Elle possède tant d'année d'expériences donc dans ce domaine.
Avec son esprit créatif et de perfectionnement professionnel, elle désire encore améliorer, développer, étendre son activité. Elle compte investir davantage afin de pouvoir réaliser son rêve d'ouvrir une grande entreprise d'imprimerie et de créer des emplois. Le seul moyen qu'elle trouve d'y parvenir est de demander de l'emprunt.
texts.en:
Sahondra is married and a mother of a family. Her husband runs a small grocery store. They have two adorable children, who are 12 and 10 years old, and who go to school.

At 35 years old, Sahondra has managed a small printing workshop since 2001. Before then, she was working only as an employee. She has many years of experience in this domaine.

With her creative spirit and professional development, she wishes to improve, develop, and expand the business. She plans to invest more so she can realize her dream of opening a larger printery and creating jobs. The only way she has found to do this is though a loan.

loans.use: to buy boxes, packaging, paper lining, reams of vellum paper, and white glue

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Mila is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell like mango, orange, etc. for her business.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell like mango, orange, etc.

loans.name: Jamson

texts.en:
Jamson who is a forty-seven-year-old, hard working, married man with four children lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He grows and sells produce as his main source of income, though he also carries out motorcycle transport. He was inspired to start this business to get income and sustain his family demands. He faces a challenge of competition and weather changes that affect his produce business. 

He has a vision of buying a pickup truck to ease the transportation process.

He is requesting a loan to buy bags of fertilizers for his coffee farm.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Carlos De La Cruz

texts.es:
Carlos es un productor de café, que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua, con su esposa y sus 2 hijos con edades de 4 y 5 años. Desde hace más de 8 años cuenta con su pequeña finca de 5.8 hectáreas, en las cuales cultiva café principalmente.

En los últimos 3 años su producción de café pergamino en promedio, ha sido de 300 quintales. Su meta este año, es mejorar los rendimientos productivos del café, para lograrlo está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos que le permita asegurar la nutrición que requiere su plantación.

El sueño de Carlos, es comprar más terreno para diversificar su finca con otros rubros como ganado y disminuir riesgos. Para lograrlo, se ha propuesto invertir para mejorar la productividad de su finca, y con ello los ingresos que le genera, para garantizar el bienestar de su familia y la realización de pequeñas inversiones.
texts.en:
Carlos is a coffee producer who lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua with his wife and two children aged 4 and 5. For more than 8 years he has had his small farm of 5.8 hectares where he grows mainly coffee. In the past 3 years his medium production of parchment coffee has been 300 quintals.

His goal this year is to improve the productive yield of his coffee and in order to do this he is requesting a loan to buy the inputs that will allow him to secure the nutrients that his plantation needs.

Carlo's dream is to buy more land to diversify his farm with other products like cattle and diminish his risk. To achieve this he intends to invest in improving the productivity of his farm and with it the income that his farm generates to guarantee the well-being of his family and to make some small investments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crops to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.fr:
Âgée de 28 ans, mère célibataire, Caroline a un adorable petit enfant de 3 ans. C'est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde, dynamique même si elle est apparemment très timide.
Depuis 2009, elle exerce l'activité de vente de vêtements friperie. Les marchandises changent toujours selon la saison. Si elle a démarré avec son propre effort (petite économie de son tirelire), actuellement, elle arrive à acheter une balle en approvisionnement.
Le crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter la quantité et de diversifier les genres de vêtements à vendre(joggings, survêtements, pantalons jeans, etc..) pour attirer des clients et pour leurs laisser beaucoup de choix.
Son souhait est de pouvoir continuer à avancer afin d'offrir une meilleur éducation  et une meilleur condition de vie à son très cher enfant.
texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old and a single mother. She has an adorable small 3-year-old child. 

This working woman is resourceful and dynamic, even though she is shy. 

Since 2009, she has worked selling used clothing. Her merchandise changes according to the season. 

If she starts with her own means (her small economy), she is able to buy a bale of clothing. This loan is going to allow her to increase the quantity she can buy and help her to diversify the types of clothing that she sells (jogging suits, track suits, jeans, etc.). This will attract customers and give them more choice. 

Her wish is to be able to advance so that she can offer the best education and best quality of life for her dear child.

loans.use: to buy a bale of jeans and tracksuits

loans.name: Milagros Concepcion

texts.es:
La socia Milagros Concepcion se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y chompas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Milagros Concepcion is dedicated to her business of buying and selling clothing. She sells pants, shirts, and sweaters. Through this business, she wants to provide for her children. She is an enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell the clothing. 

She requests the loan to buy pants, shirts, and sweaters.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and sweaters.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia Maria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de miel,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar miel.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria continues dedicating herself to the sale of honey.  She is a hardworking woman and a fighter.  Through this business she hopes to help her family do better.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase honey. She is happy to receive the loan and she promises to repay it.

loans.use: to purchase honey.

loans.name: Isain's Group

texts.en:
Isain, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Isain is representing her group of 10 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Isain has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to earn enough to send her children to school, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Isain is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 4 acres will be planted by Isain's Group, and among them they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy es un hombre de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un bebé de 8 meses, y su negocio es el corte de ladrillos.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, optimista, generoso, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Sajama’ área que une a varias zonas de la ciudad, dónde el transporte público tiene paradas, desde este lugar las personas se pueden movilizar a otras zonas alejadas, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Eddy es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultural general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su bebé que duerme todo el día. Viven en una casa propiedad de su padre construida de ladrillo, adobe y cemento con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de corte de ladrillos, cerámica, fierros, concreto, mármol y otros materiales de construcción. Para realizar su trabajo utiliza una máquina cortadora de ladrillo, se trata de un máquina destinaa al corte de materiales de construcción, su aspecto es robusto con el fin de evitar vibraciones durante el  corte, además utiliza un sistema de refrigeración por agua para el funcionamiento del disco. “inicié mi trabajo en una empresa ladrillera en dónde me enseñaron el oficio, luego me independicé y formé una familia…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que lo realiza en su domicilio, la desventaja es que aún no cuenta con una cartera de clientes constantes. Su sueño es abrir una fábrica de ladrillos, él desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ladrillos por mayor. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad independientemente. 
Es por esos motivos que Eddy solicita un préstamo para la compra de ladrillos por mayor para abrir una fábrica de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Eddy is a 21-year-old man. He lives with his partner and has an 8-month-old baby. His business is brick cutting.

He is a good father, enterprising, independent, optimistic, generous, responsible, and very hard working. His business is location in the “Sajama” area, which is one of many areas in the city where the public transit system stops. From this place, people can travel to other neighboring areas. The area has a cold and dry climate, with a temperature that varies between 2 and 14 degrees Celsius during the day. 

Eddy has brown skin, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature, and a thin physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish in everyday life and for his work. He shares his life with his partner, who is dedicated to the same work, and with his baby, who sleeps all day. They live in his father’s house, which is made of brick, adobe, and cement with a corrugated iron roof. The house has drinking water, electricity, and indoor plumbing. 

His business is cutting bricks, ceramic, iron, concrete, marble, and other construction materials. To do his work, he uses a brick-cutting machine, which is also used to cut construction materials in general. Its appearance is robust, with the goal of avoiding vibrations during the cutting. He also uses a water refrigeration system to make sure the disk functions. 

He says that he started his work in a brick-working business, through which he was taught the work. Then he says that he became independent and started a family. The advantage of his business is that he does it in his home. The disadvantage is that he still doesn’t have a set of regular clients. 

His dream is to open a brick factory. He wants to invest in his business by buying bricks wholesale. This is his first sequence of loan with the institution in the one year he has been doing this activity independently. 

It is for these reasons that Eddy requests a loan to buy bricks wholesale to open a brick factory.

loans.use: to buy bricks wholesale to open a brick factory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her farming activities to earn more income

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nina is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nina has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Nina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
María es una joven de diecinueve años de edad, encantada por el mundo de digital, informática y redes, estudia la licenciatura en Ingeniería en Sistemas. Sus padres, quienes tienen una pequeña pulpería y además trabajan para una empresa nacional, la han apoyado en todo lo que han podido, ellos más que nadie desean ver a su hija como una ingeniera exitosa. 
En la carrera que ha decidido estudiar María, es de vital importancia tener una computadora, dado que la mayor parte del trabajo se elabora en programas de computación. Es por eso que ella recurre a Kiva Junto a MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un préstamo con el que pueda comprar una laptop y avanzar en su carrera, apoyándose de las herramientas y conocimientos que ha obtenido, para realizar sus trabajos y entregarlos con mayor eficiencia y calidad. En un futuro ella desea ser la jefa de informática de alguna institución importante.
texts.en:
María is a 19 year old who is enchanted by the digital world, computing and networks. She is  studying for her degree in Systems Engineering.  Her parents, who have a small store besides working for a national company, have supported her all that they have been able to.  They, more than anyone, hope to see their daughter become a successful engineer.  

In the course of studies that Maria has decided to take, it is vital that she have a computer, given that a large part of the work is done using computer programs.  For this reason she has turned to Kiva along with MiCredito, in order to receive a loan with which she can purchase a laptop and advance her studies.  She can then use the tools and knowledge that she has obtained in order to turn in even higher quality work more efficiently.  

In the future she hopes to be the head of IT for an important company.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Maksatbek

texts.ru: Максатбек, 21 год, не женат. У него среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Максатбека, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова, 20 овец. На 4,0 Га выращивает клевер и клубнику. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Максатбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 10 овец для откорма и реализации по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Максатбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая.
texts.en: Maksatbek is 21 years old and unmarried. He has a secondary education. He rears animals and grows crops in order to get income for his family. Thanks to hard work, Maksatbek currently has a cow and twenty sheep. He grows clover and strawberries on 4.0 hectares of land. His monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further expand his business, Maksatbek has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and ten sheep to fatten up and resell at a higher price. Maksatbek plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing his number of domesticated livestock, and plans to save up to build a barn.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and ten sheep for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is 29 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has two children and is married. As a group leader, Emily is representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Emily's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Emily and her group will receive a total of seven solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 50 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child in school.

Regina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Regina has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking married lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She runs a secretarial bureau seven days a week and has been in the same business for ten years. She is faced with challenges of limited capital, that hinder progress of her business. However, in future, she has hopes of buying land to construct a house for rentals that will yield her more income. 

Ruth has asked for a loan to buy stationery for photocopying.

loans.use: to buy stationery for photocopying.

loans.name: Bernardo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Bernardo tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una comunidad rural, al norte de Nicaragua. Desde muy pequeño hacía algunas tareas de la familia en la finca de café de sus padres. Ahora cuenta con su pequeña finca de 5.6 hectáreas, de las cuales 3.5 son de café,  y está certificado por comercio justo. Los rendimientos de café que ha logrado en los últimos años, en promedio han sido de 130 quintales pergamino. 

Para este ciclo 2015-2016, él requiere un financiamiento para garantizar el mantenimiento de las plantaciones de café y continuar mejorando los rendimientos productivos. En su comunidad, este pequeño productor es calificado como una persona emprendedora, honesta y responsable. 

Estas cualidades, considera que le han ayudado a salir adelante y le permitirán crecer económicamente, que es su meta, para poder darle a sus hijos mejores condiciones que las que él ha tenido. Te invitamos a apoyar a Bernardo para ayudarle a contribuir con su propósito.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 45 years old.  He lives with his wife and their three children in a rural community in northern Nicaragua.  From a young age he did various family jobs on his parents' coffee farm.  Today he has his own small farm of 5.6 hectares, 3.5 of which are for coffee and are certified for fair trade.  The yield of coffee that he has reached in the last few years has been, on average, 130 quintals of parchment (still shelled) coffee.

For the 2015-2016 cycle, he needs a loan in order to guarantee the maintenance of his coffee farm and to continue improving the yield of production.  In his community, this small producer is known as an enterprising, honest, and responsible person.  These qualities, he says, have helped him get ahead in life and will help him grow financially, which is his goal so that he can provide his children better conditions than those that they have.

We invite you to make a loan to Bernardo to help contribute to his goal.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee farm, which is his main source of income.

loans.name: Antorcha Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (JULIA, NAYMA y SANTA BENITA), viven en  Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Hace 3 meses se organizaron en grupo solidario con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Las tres tienen pequeños negocios, JULIA y NAYMA venden productos básicos y chiverías, SANTA BENITA vende comida.

JULIA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 58 años de edad. Con cualidades de líder, Está casada con 3 hijos mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como pescador artesanal. Ella desde hace 3 años, estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, diversificar sus productos y vender mariscos y frito. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of 3 enterprising women (Julia, Nayma y Santa Benita), who live in Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. Three months ago they organized a communal bank with the aim of working together to access loans from Pana Pana and have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, and their incomes thereby improving the quality of living of their families. All three have small businesses. Julia and Nayma sell basic food products and yogurt. Santa Benita sells food.

Julia is the coordinator of the communal bank and is a friendly 58 year old woman with leadership qualities. She is married and has 3 adult children. Her husband works informally as a small scale fisherman. She has had a small store in the corridor of her veranda of her wood and stilt house. In this way she generates her own income and contribute to the household expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, yogurt, diversify her products and sell seafood and fried food. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, yogurt, diversify her products and sell seafood and fried food.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, comenta que su meta es poder recibirse como un profesional, pero seguir estudiando para poder capacitarse. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en cubrir sus gastos de transporte para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
Hoy pide de nuevo este préstamo para poder usarlo en las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo, también agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y estudiando.
texts.en:
Oscar is from the city of Ybycuí. He says that his goal is to be received as a professional, and he continues studying to achieve this. His previous loan was used to cover his transportation expenses so that he could continue with his studies as he had been doing.

Now, he asks again for a loan to cover his university costs. In this way, he will be able to continue fighting as he has been. He is also thankful for this new opportunity, which he receives to continue growing and studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Kenny Efrain

texts.es: El socio Kenny Efrain se dedica al negocio de artesania, el socio vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, el socio vende diferentes tejidos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
texts.en:
Kenny Efrain works in the artisanal business.  He sells weavings, sweaters and blankets.  He sells a variety of weavings.  

He works form 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m..  He has been doing this work for eight years and it is going very well.  His dream is to increase his business of selling the weavings.  

He is asking for the loan to purchase weavings, sweaters and fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, sweaters and weavings.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de extinguidores y botiquines,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de extinguidores y botiquines.La socia solicita le credito para comprar extinguidores y botiquines.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues to make a living selling fire extinguishers and first aid kits. She has worked in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business selling fire extinguishers and first aid kits. She is requesting the loan to buy fire extinguishers and first aid kits.

Luz Marina is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fire extinguishers and first aid kits.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Virginia is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

Virginia has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Virginia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Kasikon's Group

texts.en:
Kasikon is a 52-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Kasikon has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Kasikon described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Kasikon’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Tumana Utiwe Vu Women Group

texts.en:
Loise is the name of the woman raising her hand in the photograph. She is a member of Tumana Utiwe Vu women's group. She is fifty-seven years old, married, and a mother of four. In June 2014, she joined Hand In Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development.

She operates a general retail shop where she sells goods like sugar, salt, tea leaves, cooking fat and other household items. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more foodstuffs, e.g., sugar, tea leaves, cooking fat, and salt to add stock to her general retail shop.  This will increase her income hence she will be in a position to provide for the basic necessities of her family with ease. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs, e.g., sugar, salt, tea leaves and cooking fat to add to the inventory of her general retail shop.

loans.name: Oibek

texts.ru: Ойбек молодой мужчина в возрасте 31 года. Он проживает в сельской местности и занимается принимательской деятельностью. Ойбек женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Сам Ойбек родился и вырос в селе который находиться далеко от города. Он с детства занимался бизнесом вместе с мамой, когда ездили в другой город и привозили детскую одежду. Ойбек совмещал работу и учебу. Закончив школу Ойбек своими силами поступил в ВУЗ на медицинский факультет. Получив диплом он стал работать по специальности и совмещать бизнес. На данный момент у Ойбека затруднения с финансами и что бы закончить строительство дома ему не хватает денег. С данной проблемой он решил обратиться в МДО Арванд за поддержкой. На полученные деньги Ойбек хочет доделать ремонт и установить пластиковые окна и двери. Ойбек заранее благодарит за финансовую помощь сельским жителям.
texts.en: Oibek is a young 31-year-old man. He lives in a rural area and is an entrepreneur. Oibek is married and has a child. Oibek was born and raised in a village situated far from a town. He worked in business with his mother since childhood, when they would travel to another town and bring back children's clothes. Oibek combined work and studies. On finishing school, Oibek got a place in a university medical school through his own efforts. Having received his degree, he started work in his profession and combined it with business. At the moment Oibek has financial difficulties and he has insufficient money to finish building his home. He decided to turn to MDO Arvand for support with this problem. With this money, Oibek wants to finish his building work and install plastic windows and doors. Oibek thanks you in advance for your support of rural residents.

loans.use: to buy building materials and PVC windows.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo como policia,el socio también sigue teniendo su negocio de una empresa de servicio de seguridad, el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo quiere sacar adelante a su familia . El socio solicita comprar un televisor para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rafael continues to work as a policeman and running a business providing security services. He is a hardworking man, who, through his work, wants to support his family. He is requesting the loan to buy a television set for his home.

Rafael is grateful for this loan and is committed to making his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy a television set for his home.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
El socio William se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, el socio es una persona reponsable y trabajador,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. El socio solicita le crédito para comprar  polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
William continues working in clothing sales.  He is a hardworking and responsible person.  His dream is to increase his clothing sales.  

He is asking for the loan to purchase pullover shirts, sweaters and blouses.  He is happy about the loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: to purchase pullover shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy saws and other implements for carving purposes and also start a soapstone shop where he would keep his items after carving.

loans.name: Umiisyo Wa Koo S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Pauline, 54 years old, married and a mother of four children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013 to benefit from the training offered mainly on savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management.

Pauline operates a green grocer store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy assorted fruits and vegetables, e.g. cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, mangoes and passion fruits, hence adding stock for increased income to enable her to meet her family's expenses.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits and vegetables, e.g. cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, mangoes and passion fruits, hence adding stock for increased income.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда, 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Мавлуда в поисках доходов для своей семьи начала свой бизнес по откорму скота и полеводству. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, на 0,80 Га собственного и 1,0 Га арендованного земельного надела выращивает огурцы, помидоры, клевер, клубнику. Бизнес очень хороший, приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме около 17,000 сом (KGS). Она решила в этом году отремонтировать сарай и построить загон, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS) на покупку шифера, цемента. На доходы от кредита Мавлуда хочет продолжить развивать свое дело.
texts.en: Mavluda is 53 years old and married. She and her husband are raising five children. In search of income for her family, Mavluda began an animal rearing and crop growing business. She has two cows, and she grows cucumbers, tomatoes, clover, and strawberries on 0.8 hectares of her own and 1.0 hectares of rented land. Business is very good and brings her a monthly income of about 17,000 som (KGS). She has decided to repair her barn this year and to build a corral, and so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 140,000 som (KGS) to buy slate and cement. Mavluda will continue to develop her business using the profits from the loan.

loans.use: to buy slate and cement in order to construct a corral for her livestock.

loans.name: Gularus

texts.ru: Это Гуларус. Ей 26 лет. Она на районе живет вместе мужем, тестю и свекровью. Гулрухсор пока не имеет детей. Она серьезная и гостеприимная женщина. Гуларус занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она занимается этой деятельности 2 года. Гуларус хочет купить новую швейную машинку марки «YAMATA», чтобы улучшить процесс своей  работы и привлечь больше клиентов. Ее доходы от этой деятельностью. Ей не хватает денег, чтобы купить желаемую швейную машинку, и она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: This is Gularus. She is 26 years old. She lives in the area with her husband and her father-in-law and mother-in-law. Gularus does not yet have children. She is a serious and hospitable woman. Gularus sews women's clothes to order. She has been doing this for two years. Gularus wants to buy a new Yamata brand sewing machine in order to improve her workflow and attract more clients. She does not have enough money to buy the desired sewing machine, and so she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new Yamata brand sewing machine.

loans.name: Alejandrina Benita

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina Benita se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la scia quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gaseosas y cervezas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandrina Benita continues in the business of selling soft drinks and beer.  She is a hard working and enterprising woman who wants to advance herself through this business.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase sodas and beer.  She is happy about the loan and she promises to repay it.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 53 años de edad, viudo, tiene un hijo varón de 13 años y una hija mujer de 22 años, y su negocio es la confección de calzados.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, optimista, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Señor de exaltación’ área residencial alejada de la ciudad, construcciones de adobe algunas con techo de paja son las que llenan el lugar. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Victor es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultural general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; la mayor le ayuda en el trabajo y el menor se encuentra estudiando en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo, adobe y cemento con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección y venta de zapatos de cholita. Se llama chola a la mujer de vestir tradicional; usa sombrero, manta y pollera. Parte importante de su vestimenta son los zapatos; que son planos y cambian constantemente de diseño. Su trabajo consiste en unir las plantillas, horma, suela, tacos, etc., hasta confeccionar un zapato, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija mayor que se encarga de costurar y darle forma al zapato. “inicié mi actividad como ayudante de zapatero, aprendí bien el oficio y me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que debido a los años de experiencia, cuenta con una amplia agenda de clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materiales de confección. Su sueño es ampliar su taller y contratar ayudantes para confeccionar mayor cantidad, el desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de materiales de confección de zapatos, como; suelas, telas, cuero, pegamento y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Victor solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de confección de zapatos, para contratar ayudantes y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Victor is a 53-year-old widower who has a son aged 13 and a daughter aged 22. He has a shoemaking business.

Victor is a good father, and is enterprising, optimistic, independent, responsible and hardworking. His business is located in the residential ‘Señor de Exaltación’ district on the outskirts of the city. The area is full of adobe houses, some of which have straw roofs. The climate is cold and dry, and the temperature during the day varies between 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Victor is olive-skinned, with brown eyes and short black hair. He is short and slim. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with his family. He also speaks Spanish, which he uses in his business. He shares his life with his children. The eldest helps him out with his work and the youngest studies at school. They live in their own home, made of bricks, adobe and cement, with a corrugated iron roof. Their home has drinking water, electricity, gas and a sanitation system.

Victor has a business making and selling traditional, "cholita" shoes. "Chola" is the name given to a woman who wears traditional Bolivian clothing, such as a bowler hat, shawl and long skirt. Their shoes, which are flat-heeled and constantly change design, are an important part of their clothing. Victor's work involves putting the soles, insoles, heels and the rest of the shoe together. He does this with the help of his daughter, who sews together and shapes the shoes. Victor explains that "I began working as a shoemaker's assistant. I learned the trade thoroughly and went independent." 

The advantage of his business is that thanks to his years of experience, he has a lot of regular customers. The disadvantage is that he lacks capital to buy materials. His dream is to expand his workshop and employ assistants to make more shoes. He wants to grow his business by buying shoemaking materials such as soles, fabric, leather, glue and other items.

This is his first set of loans with the institution in the 12 years he has spent working as an independent shoemaker. For the reasons given above, Victor is requesting a loan to buy shoemaking materials, employ assistants and increase production.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to make shoes, employ assistants and increase production.

loans.name: Everline's Group

texts.en:
Everline is married and has four children. She is a group leader, representing 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund  in 2008 and decided to represent her group because she likes being a leader. 

With a portion of this loan, Everline will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Everline plans to use the profits she gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total, Everline’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Shamsiddin
