texts.ru: Простой мужчина из района Вахдата, Шамсиддин решил начать свой бизнес. Он долго не смог найти работу и решил купить машину и начать предоставлять услуги таксиста. Он верный муж прекрасный отец, отличный семьянин, осталось только быть успешным мужчиной. Он составил бизнес-план и ему необходимо купить машинку. У Шамсиддина уже есть опыт работы. Шамсиддин очень надеется на финансирование. Он никогда не боялся трудиться. И таким он воспитает детей своих детей.
texts.en: A simple man from the Vahdat region, Shamsiddin has decided to start a business. He could not find work for a long time, and has decided to buy a car and begin offering a taxi service. He is a faithful husband, a wonderful father, and a great family man, and now he just needs to become successful. He has drawn up a business plan and he needs to buy a car. Shamsiddin already has work experience. Shamsiddin hopes very much to get funding. He has never been afraid of work. And this is how he is bringing up his children.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 45 years old, married, and has four children. He is from Maghlaki. Gela is busy with a small scale agricultural business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the income for the family is the monthly income from their agricultural business. 

Gela has a plot of land and owns cattle. The family earns small income from selling agricultural products at the local market. It is hardly enough for food for his family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Gela requested a loan from Credo, which he will use to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Gela plans to build a greenhouse in the yard and cultivate vegetables and greens. He will also purchase tires for his own tractor and start working on private orders.

This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Gela will get the chance to improve the living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and purchase tires for his tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soapstone washing detergent to make the curved items clean and produce quality items for competition in the market.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un pequeño productor de café, con 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en su pequeña finca de 6.65 hectáreas, la cual se ubica en una comunidad alejada de Jinotega, en donde el difícil acceso y la distancia generan un incremento en los costos de productos de uso y consumo diario.

En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 150 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación comercio justo. Para este ciclo, él está requiriendo un financiamiento para comprar los insumos agrícolas que requiere su cafetal para lograr un mayor rendimiento y calidad.

La meta de Gustavo es aumentar los rendimientos de sus áreas, para lo cual se está proponiendo invertir, ya que asegura que todo cultivo necesita ser atendido adecuadamente para obtener buenos resultados. Te animamos a apoyar a este emprendedor en el logro de sus objetivos que ayudarán a su familia a tener mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Gustavo, age 54, is a small coffee producer.  He lives with his wife and two children on his small farm of 6.65 hectares, which is located in the remote community of Jinotega.  Because of the difficult access and the distance, the cost of products and daily consumption items is higher.  In recent years, this producer has had a crop of approximately 15,000 pounds of pergamino (parchment) coffee, which he produces under the criteria of Fair Trade certification.  

For this cycle, he is requiring financing to purchase the agricultural supplies which his coffee plantation requires to achieve better performance and quality.  Gustavo's goal is to increase the performance of his land.  To reach this goal he is proposing to invest, as all crops will need to be adequately attended to in order to obtain good results.  

We encourage you to support this entrepreneur in the achievement of his objectives which will help his family to have better economic conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies required for his coffee plantation, which will help him to have more income for his family.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 26 years old and single. He is a poultry farmer. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013, which developed his entrepreneurship spirit through training and mentorship.

Simon is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase poultry feeds to sustain his chickens during the dry period. He hopes this will ensure they produce eggs and meat, earning him profits to support his needs such as food and medical care.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 62 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Sarah is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Sarah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Sarah’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Charles Group

texts.en:
Charles, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Charles is representing his group of 15 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Charles has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Charles is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 7.5 acres will be planted by Charles's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is still living alone and she doesn't have children; she is living at her parents house. Bertha is making money as a seamstress; she makes vests and this time she needs a loan to build a room at her parents house (in the future that house will be her property, so it is not a bad idea to make an investment there) 

Bertha has the chance to rent the room or to install her workshop there. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un lugar mas grande para vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita still works in her business of raising animals.  She wants to provide for her family through this business.  Her dream is to have a larger space to sell the animals.

She is asking for the loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens as well as their food.  She is happy about the loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens, as well as food for the animals.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has a boyfriend and she lives with him at Carmen Lipe Community; she has her own adobe house 

Julia sells milk. She learned about this business when she was very young. Her boyfriend is a public employee. 

Julia needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she thinks she is ready to produce more milk, although she does all the work alone 

She hopes you can trust her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his customers daily.

loans.name: Yunuke

texts.en:
Yunuke is 48 years old, married, and supports a family of four members. She has been operating as a small scale farmer for the last 27 years and earns KES 12,000 per month. 

Yunuke has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to add more farming tools for high production in her farming. She plans to use the anticipated profits to improve her farming activities for more income.

Her future hopes and dreams are to produce quality and quantity farm supplies in the market.

loans.use: to add more farming tools for high production in her farming

loans.name: Majalia

texts.en:
Majalia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Majalia is 36 years old and has six children who are in school.

Majalia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and do other maintenance for her business.

Majalia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and do other maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is 25 years old, married with three children, and living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Ezra is a tailor and has owned a tailoring work shop for many years. He has a dream of educating his children and expanding his business, as he minds al ot about his children's survival and business continuity. However limited capital hinders his dream. 

Ezra wants to buy textiles for making men's and ladies suits.

loans.use: to buy textiles for making men's and ladies suits.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He mainly deals in livestock and farming. He has been a farmer for the past eleven years, where he mainly grows bananas and coffee. He was forced to start up these businesses to meet his family demands. He faces bad weather challenges and a scarcity of resources to buy more cows to sell. He has hopes of becoming a prominent businessman.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Muy trabajador y responsable es Efraín, un hombre de treinta y ocho años de edad, que se dedica a ser agricultor, en su finca siembra maíz y frijoles. Él es padre de tres hijos, con el apoyo de su esposa logran mantener sus cosechas para luego ofrecerlas. Efraín ya había sido beneficiado con un crédito de Kiva junto MiCrédito, con él pudo sacar adelante una cosecha que casi se le echaba a perder.
En estos momentos, este responsable hombre, ha vuelto a solicitar un préstamo, esta vez planea usarlo para comprar abono, pesticidas y todos los insumos necesarios para sembrar frijoles. Confía en Kiva junto a MiCrédito, además está muy agradecido. Planea seguir trabajando con ambos, para poco a poco ir adquiriendo ganado bovino y convertirse en ganadero.
texts.en:
Efraín is a very hardworking and responsible man who is 38 years old and has dedicated himself to agriculture.  On his farm he plants corn and beans.  He is father to three children.  With the support of his wife they are able to maintain their crops and then sell them.  

Efrain has already received a loan from Kiva with MiCredito and with it was able to successfully finish a crop that he almost lost.  

At this time, this responsible man has solicited another loan.  This time he plans to use it to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and all products needed to plant beans.  He trusts in Kiva and MiCredito, besides being very grateful.  He plans to continue working with both in order to little by little acquire cattle and convert himself to a rancher.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and all products needed to plant beans.

loans.name: Festus's Group

texts.en:
Festus is 53 years old and has 12 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 16 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Festus has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Festus also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Festus's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 11 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mining tools for more digging of soapstone to enable him to make more items to sell from it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied daily to his clients.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 60 years old. He is married with 9 children aged between 7 and 25 years, They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been in business for the past 11 years, while his wife is a business-woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows to rear. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows to rear.

loans.name: Dúo Ángel De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Ángel de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está formado por doña Daila, ella tiene 48 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de consumo diario en su local ubicado frente al parque de Santo Tomas Milpas Altas desde ya hace varios años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de aceite mediano, grande, dos cajas de huevos, cajas de sopas instantáneas, una caja de pastas, y detergente en polvo, su propósito de comprar por mayor es vender a un precio cómodo a sus clientes, así como surtir y atender a las necesidades de sus clientes.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Productos comestibles para vender.
texts.en: The Dúo Ángel de Santo Tomas group is made up two women. One of them is Daila, who is 48 years old and has made a living selling everyday groceries in her store opposite Santo Tomas Milpas Altas park for several years. She is requesting a loan to buy medium oil, two boxes of eggs, boxes of instant soup, one box of pasta, and soap powder. Her reason for buying wholesale is to sell her products at a better price for her customers, as well as stock her store and meet her customers' needs. She is requesting this loan to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more farming tools for high production in her farming

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman and has 5 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells mattresses, pillows, chairs and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an area with high customer inflow and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

Alice will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy stocks of mattresses, chairs, pillows and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a better life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stocks of mattresses, chairs, pillows and other items

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. Peter also does farming to supplement his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the 120,000 KES loan to service and maintain his motorcycle and buy farm inputs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Deydamia Vanessa

texts.es:
Deydamia es una joven muy carismática y entregada a servir a sus pacientes, ella está en su último año de la licenciatura en odontología. Teniendo solo el apoyo de su madre, la cual tuvo que migrar a otro país, ha hecho que esta joven luche día a día por su objetivo, el cual es, ser una profesional de éxito y un orgullo para su madre. En la actualidad ella ya inicio a prestar sus servicios en una clínica en la cual le dan una ayuda para transporte y almuerzo. 
Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera con el sueño  de  ayudar a las personas con problemas relacionados a su salud bucal, ahora que ya se encuentra a un paso de realizar su sueño, ha decidido recurrir a Kiva junto MiCrédito para que pueda ver concretado su anhelo, es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de titulación y así egresar para comenzar a contribuir al desarrollo de la sociedad.
texts.en:
Deydamia is a very charismatic young girl who is dedicated to serving her patients. She is in her final year of a degree in dentistry. She has only had the help of her mother who has had to emigrate to another country and so she has had to fight day by day for her aim which is to be a successful professional and for her mother to be proud of her. Currently she has started to lend her services in a clinic in which they give her help for transport and lunch.
She decided to study this course with the dream of being able to help people with problems related to their mouth health. Now that she is just one step away from achieving her dream she has decided to turn to Kiva along with MiCrédito so that she can see her dream become a reality. This is why she is asking for a loan to pay for her university fees and thus graduate and start to contribute to the development of society.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Vionila

texts.en:
Vionila is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vionila is 24 years old now.

Vionila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Vionila requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

 In the future, Vionila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mayilah

texts.en:
This is twenty-seven year-old Mayilah.  She is single and has one child, aged six. 

In 2005, Mayilah established her local foodstuff, groundnut, and beans business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her personal needs and her child, and her main customers are adults. She opens her business seven days a week and thirteen hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mayilah requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of groundnut, beans, garrie, etc., for resale. She hopes that this loan will help the business to expand. In the future, Mayilah plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of groundnuts, beans, etc., for resale

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old and has nine children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Agnes is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Agnes started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to the best seed prices. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Agnes’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Teegawende Fatimata Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe TEEGAWENDE FATIMATA. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus a 17ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge. 

Mme vend des céréales depuis 2005. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.

Elle veut s’acheter 05sacs de maïs, 05sacs de petit mil.

Mme  veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et s'occuper de sa mère.
NB: le bébé qu'elle a mis au dos sur la photo appartient au membre en habit blanc qui souri à sa gauche.
texts.en:
Mme Fatimata is responsible for the group called Teegawende Fatimata. Married, she is the mother of three children. The oldest is 17 and the youngest is 5 years old. Two of them attend school, and she is responsible for four people.  

Mme Fatimata has been selling cereals since 2005. She buys her supplies in nearby markets.  She wishes to buy 5 sacks of maize and 5 sacks of local millet. 

Mme Fatimata wishes to use her profit to expand her business. She would like to keep her children in school and take care of her own mother.  
NB: The baby on the woman's back in the picture belongs to the woman in white smiling on the left.

loans.use: to buy one sack of fertilizer, two containers of onion seeds, and two tins of insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens to start poultry farming that will supplement her income.

loans.name: Kokies Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (JENNY MARIA, ESMERALDA y ELVIA), todas pertenecen a la etnia miskita y viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan diario para generar ingresos desde sus pequeños negocios. JENNY MARIA y ELVIA son dueñas de una pequeña pulpería, ESMERALDA vende ropa usada. Con las pequeñas ganancias que obtuvieron con el crédito anterior lograron avanzar en sus propósitos. Están solicitando su segundo préstamo para continuar mejorando en sus negocios.

ELVIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario Kokies, es una señora afable de 37 años de edad. Madre soltera de 2 hijos: El mayor de 20 años estudia su carrera universitaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 7 años inicio vendiendo frito, con las ganancias percibidas y con el prestamo otorgado anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar sus productos, actualmente ha establecido una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece productos básicos y ropa usada, en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos en Managua: Una paca de ropa usada mixta, granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y poder asumir con menos presión los gastos de educación de sus hijos y resolver las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una tienda donde venda ropa, especialmente ropa usada que es lo que más demanda la población actualmente.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three women (Jenny Maria, Esmeralda, and Elvia).  They are all of the Miskita ethnicity, and they live in Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality.  They are enterprising women who struggle daily to generate income with their small businesses.

Jenny Maria and Elvia have small stores.  Esmeralda sells used clothes.  With the small profits that they got with their last loan they managed to make progress on their goals.  They are requesting a second loan in order to continue improving their businesses.

Elvia is a member of the Kokies communal bank.  She is a good-natured 37 year old woman.  She is the single mother of two children.  The oldest is 20 years old and is studying for a university degree.  Her other child is four years old.  In order to get her children ahead, she started selling deep fried snacks seven years ago.  With the profits that she got and with the previous loan through PANA PANA and Kiva, she was able to diversify her products.  She has now established a small store where she sells basic products and used clothes in the corridor of her home, which is a stilt house made of wood. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more products in Managua.  She will buy a mixed bundle of used clothes, basic grains, yogurt, and other products to sell.  She will do this in order to increase her earnings and to be able to assume her children’s educational expenses and provide for her household’s basic needs with less pressure.

She dreams of having enough capital to establish a store where she sells clothes.  She especially wants to sell used clothes in the store because that is what there is now more demand for from the public.

loans.use: to buy a mixed bundle of used clothes, basic grains, yogurt, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Zouhéra

texts.fr: Zouhéra est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè. Agée de 31 ans et mère de trois enfants, Zouhéra est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentations générales dans son cafétéria. Grâce à ce commerce, Zouhéra trouve son revenu afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille. Zouhéra s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de lait, Zouhéra demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice.
texts.en:
Zouhéra, age 31, is a married mother to three children who lives in Agoè. She sells basic food products from her cafeteria. Thanks to this business, Zouhéra earns the income necessary to help provide for her family. 

Zouhéra buys merchandise four times per month at the market. She is seeking this loan to buy cartons of milk. The profits earned through this activity will help her to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy several cartons of milk

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Anne, 27 years old and a mother of three. Two of her children are school going. Her economic activity is rabbit keeping. Anne joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to expand her knowledge on enterprise development and financial management. This has equipped her with skills that have helped her improve the management of her business. She needs a loan to build a better hutch and buy quality feed for her rabbits. She believes this will greatly help her increase her income so she is in a position to provide for the basic necessities of her family including providing quality education and health care.

Anne is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy rabbit feed and pay for construction of a rabbit hutch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to enable him get more milk for sell and hopes this will enable him to increase his income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start another business by buying a dairy cow for milk production and sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and sales

loans.name: Rhetchel

texts.en:
Rhetchel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rhetchel has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like bamboo sticks, etc.

Rhetchel has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business like bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Abdul Karim.  He is married and has two children aged 16 and 11 years old, both of whom are school going children. In 2004, Abdul Karim established his building material and electrical items business.  Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about  5,013,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. 

Abdul Karim has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional electrical appliances and other building items like electric wires, cartons of lamp holders, tons of iron rods etc . In the future, Abdul Karim plans to add other products. Abdul is building a house as planned. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase electrical appliances and other building items.

loans.name: Jyambere Group

texts.en: Jyambere is a group led by Anne Marie, who is 62 years old. The group name means “Forward” in English. She is married with eight children aged between 7 and 31 years old. Five of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been doing business for the past 18 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Most people in Kenya dream of getting well-paying jobs. Eric, from the Chuka area of Kenya, has never secured one and has opted to be a smallholder farmer. He decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. Eric is blessed with two beautiful children whom he refers to as his "heart beat.” His primary sources of income are milk and poultry farming, as well as some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income (in the motorbike industry). Deciding to practice poultry farming for Eric was not difficult. For the past five years, Eric has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and he wants to increase his poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it is a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Eric is going to make more income that will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As times keep getting harder, Eric is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Remigio

texts.en:
Remigio is a 65 year old, hardworking, married man with 24 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He earns an income from cattle rearing and operation of a community clinic. He faces a challenge of the prolonged dry season limiting the quality and growth of his animals to be taken to the market though he hopes to reasonably expand his business.

Remigio will use the loan to buy bulls for fattening. It is true Remigio has all the children talked about as he has many wives who have produced.

loans.use: to buy bulls to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Korca's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2010,il regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Diabou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est mariée,est âgée de  35 ans et mére de 05 enfants dont 04 filles .

Son activité est le commerce de fruits et de légumes.

Avec le prêt,elle compte acheter 20 sceaux de pâte d'arachide à 6000f le sceau,01 sac de 50 kg de patate à 10000f,03 sacs de 50kg de carottes à 10000f le sac de carote.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants ,leur nourriture et les frais de santé.
texts.en:
This group, created in 2010, is composed of members living in the same village. Their work involves small-scale commerce. 

Diabou, appearing at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is 35 years old and a mother of five children, including four girls.

Her business involves fruit & vegetables. 

With this loan, she intends to buy 20 pails of peanut butter at 6,000 francs each; a 50-kg sack of sweet potatoes at 10,000 francs; and three 50-kg sacks of carrots at 10,000 francs per sack.  

Her goal is to ensure the costs of her children’s schooling, food, and healthcare are covered.

loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables and some peanut butter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her quarrying activities by buying tools for quarry inorder to be more efficient as well as realize for more income

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 51 years old, married to Prisca, and he supports six family members. 

He has been a brick seller for the last six years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES. 13,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which he plans to buy a dairy cow to enable him meet the increasing demand of milk in his area.He looks forward to making tremendous milk sales.

Timothy hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of study. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him meet the increasing demand of milk in his area

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 52 years old, married to Milkah, and he supports six family members.

He has been a brick maker and seller for the last 20 years, and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which he plans to buy a dairy cow.This will enable him to realize more profits and expand his businesses.
 
He hope to use anticipated profit to repay the loan as well as become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samuel is a smallholder farmer who is very dedicated to his work. His tenacity and perseverance have allowed him to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in his life. He is a father of four from Nkubu, a remote town in the central province of Kenya. He has spent the past 20 years of his life farming. He keeps goats and sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on his farm. He also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Samwel is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities he involves himself in, poultry farming is closest to his heart.

Samwel wants to diversify and start a cereal selling business. He is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Nkubu area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Samwel will be able to sell cereal to the local market and to his neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and he will also be able to save extra money. Samwel is very concerned about his children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. He dreams of a secure future for his children. Samwel awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 54 years old, married to Milka, and he supports six family members. He has been a motorcycle operator for the last 20 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to buy a dairy cow. This will enable him to earn more income through the milk sales and hence re-invest into his motorcycle business. 

He plans to use the earned profits to repay the loan and re-invest into his his transport business as well as add more dairy cows.
 
He hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Tulia

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, vive junto a dos de ellos y un nieto, y reside en una comunidad del Municipio de Choloma Cortes.
La Señora Maria tiene un negocio de pulpería. Lo inició hace 13 años, vende refrescos, agua en bolsa, churos, galletas,jugos naturales y jugos de caja. Este es su préstamo con ODEF numero nueve, y la cantidad que solicita es de 25,000 lempiras para surtir de refrescos, jugos, golosinas, agua etc. Para seguir vendiendo y brindando un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su meta es que su negocio crezca cada día y quede como un patrimonio familiar de donde se pueda sacar la fuente de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and is a single mother of three children. She lives with two of her children and one grandchild. She lives in a community in the Municipio de Choloma Cortes.
She has a grocery store business which she started 13 years ago. She sells soft drinks, water in bags, churros, biscuits, natural juices and cartons of juice. This is her ninth loan with ODEF and the amount she is asking for is 25,000 lempiras in order to stock up with soft drinks, juices, sweets, water, etc., in order to continue selling and giving her customers better service.
Her aim is for her business to grow everyday and stay a family business from which she can make an income to cover her household needs.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets, water and juices to sell.

loans.name: Urunani Iii Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline  fait partie du groupe  Urunani III et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 31 ans et est mariée à Eddy un  maçon. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants l'un  3 et l'autre 6 ans, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 1 enfant membre de sa famille élargie qui étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de  riz, de haricot, de l'huile de palme dans son restaurant depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz  et de  haricot  à revendre cuits dans son restaurant pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Urunani III Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 31 years old and married to Eddy, a mason.  Together they have 2 children aged 3 and 6 years old,  all of which are studying.  She is also responsible for one child from within her extended family, who is studying.

Jacqueline has been selling rice, palm oil and beans in her restaurant for seven years.  This will be her fourth loan with the field partner, Turame, and it will increase her working capital so she can buy a large quantity of rice and beans.

In the coming years, Jacqueline would like to see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome is 29 years old. He is married, he owns a bar and he has been in business for the past 6 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more beer to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more beer to resell.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe is 36 years old. She is married with six children aged between 1 and 12 years. Three of them go to school. 

She owns a bar and she has been doing a business for the past one year. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a single man. He describes himself as humble. He operates a food stall where he sells french fries. He has been involved in this business for two years.

His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are of all types. His business goal is to open another business within five years. 

This is Evans' second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy a deep fryer to cook french fries.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer to cook french fries.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, is a 47 year old married woman, who lives in the village of Vardzia. Her husband and son are unemployed. The family earns a living with small scale agribusiness. Nino is engaged in cattle breeding and generates a really small income, that is hardly enough for a 3-member family to meet even basic needs. They live in poverty, as having no source of significant income leads to financial difficulties. Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of the low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Nino plans to purchase a special tractor for her husband, who will work on private orders and make an income to meet the daily family costs and other expenses. 
Nino and her family members rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will highly appreciate your support, as the loan is very essential for the family's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase a special tractor to generate income for her family.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en: Japheth is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest. He operates an M-pesa business and a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 55,000 loan to add M-pesa float and to buy stock of sugar, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: add M-pesa float and buy stock of sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a married woman, with 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows bananas and has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy banana seedlings. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy banana seedlings

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is a married man with three children. He describes himself as competent. He operates a farm where he grows maize and wheat and also keeps livestock. He has been involved in this business for four years.

His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are individuals. He says that his biggest business challenge is bad weather.

This is Philemon's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Philemon's business goal is to have a stable farm within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lindah

texts.en: Lindah has 1 child and describes herself to be visionary. She operates a butchery where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in an area with high customer inflow and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. Her business goal is to have multiple butcheries within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his motor vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for more production on his farm.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is married and the mother of two children. She describes herself as honest and industrious, and operates a retail business where she sells spare parts for cars. She has been in this business for the last six years and does her selling in a competitive area where she attracts all types of customers. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient working capital, and has requested a Kes 100,000 loan to buy more auto parts to sell. Her goal is to be a supplier of parts to other businesses within five years. Winnie hopes that in the future, she and her family will be able to live a good life. This is her fourth loan from the SMEP Microfinance bank; her previous ones were all repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more auto spare parts.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 36-years-old woman with five children, who are in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marites has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Adinakan

texts.ru: Адинакан, 47 лет, вдова, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Адинакан занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Адинакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 16 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Адинакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Адинакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en:
Adinakan is 47 years old, a widow, and has a son. She has secondary education. As the main breadwinner for her family, Adinakan works in animal husbandry. 

Thanks to Adinakan's persistent work, today her farm has two cows and sixteen sheep. The monthly income is about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, Adinakan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS). This will allow her to buy ten sheep for fattening up and subsequently sell them at the market for a high price.

Adinakan plans to invest the finances from the loan in the further increasing of numbers of livestock animals, and intends to save funds in order to carry out wedding celebrations for her son.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 30 years old. She is married with two children, they are one and five and not yet in school. Gaudence sells clothes and has been in this business for the past nine years. With this loan, she would like to buy more dresses to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more dresses to resell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and has 8 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, bamboo leaves, etc..

Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, bamboo leaves, etc.

loans.name: Umedahon

texts.ru:
Умедахон шустрая и активная женщина. Она занимается шитьем женской и детской одежды у себя дома. Она 3 года назад освоила кроить и сшить одежды. Сейчас у нее хорошо получается с своей работой. В швейном деле ей нравится сшить женскую одежду и ежедневный доход. 
Умедахон замужем и имеет детей. Муж занимается ремонтом домов на родном районе. Его доходы от этой деятельности. Умедахон живет вместе мужем и детьми. 
Сейчас Умедахон решила поменять старую швейную машинку, потому что ее нынешняя машинка не выполняет хорошо свою функции, и по этой причине она просит кредит для купли швейной машинки. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей приобрести швейную машинку и ускорить процесс работы. Умедахон заранее выражает сою благодарность.
texts.en:
Umedahon is a bright and active woman. She works from home sewing women's and children's clothes. Three years ago she started cutting and sewing clothes. Today she has turned out to be good with her work. In the sewing business she likes sewing women's clothes and getting a daily income.

Umedahon is married and has children. Her husband works as a home repairman in their home district. His earnings are from this business. Umedahon lives together with her husband and children.

Now Umedahon has decided to change her old sewing machine, because her current sewing machine does not function properly. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. The required loan will help her to obtain a sewing machine and speed up the process of her work. Umedahon expresses her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Blanca Libia

texts.es:
Blanca es madre soltera de una hija de 3 años de edad; desde hace aproximadamente 3 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece productos como ropa y perfumería y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor como blusas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros, así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada, mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Blanca, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hija una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is the single mother of a three-year-old daughter who. In need of a way to support herself and her child, she observed how other entrepreneurs ran retail operations, then went into business herself. Blanca sells products such as clothing and perfume, and her sales are growing as she meets potential new customers every day.

Blanca is applying for a loan for the purchase of wholesale items including blouses, jeans, shoes, perfume and accessories. This investment will allow her to meet growing customer demand this season and boost her income. 

Blanca wants to keep applying her effort and dedication to keep growing her business. She hopes to set up a warehouse at a commercial site where she can sell a greater variety of items, making her business more profitable and sustainable.  Blanca's greatest hope is to ensure that her daughter has a high-quality education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale items including blouses, jeans, shoes, perfume and accessories.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is a 67 year old married man, from the of village of Kitskhi. He has a pensioner mother, wife and son. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times before for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. The only source of finance for the family is the monthly income from their agricultural business. They have a vineyard and a plot of land where nut trees and maize are grown. They sell nuts and wine at the local open market. It is hardly enough to provide food for a four-member-family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the category of the vulnerable poor. Guram requested a loan from Credo to build a greenhouse and expand his agribusiness. 

His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Guram plans to purchase the necessary equipment for a greenhouse and to cultivate vegetables, which will be sold for a good price at the local market. 
The start up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased with help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and expand his agribusiness

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is 26 years old, married to Pascaliah and he supports 3 family members. 
He has been operating an electronic appliances shop for the last 4 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 
He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to buy more stocks of electronics and electrical appliances for sale to his customers. 
He hopes to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of electronics and electrical appliances for sale to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 52 years old married woman with one child, who is at school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc..

Helen has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 46 years old married woman with five children, who are in school She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gloria has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc..

Gloria has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy waragi (local brew) to sell.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en: Policarpio is married but he lives alone with his wife because his sons are adults already and they have their own families. Policarpio makes cheese to earn some money. He learned about this business when he was a kid. He needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Policarpio is assisted by his wife. He hopes you can trust him because he works hard and he is responsible. He and his wife are also healthy.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a married man with four children. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a farm where he grows crops and also keeps cows. He has been involved in this business for five years.

His primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

This is Johnson's second  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He  successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy another cow.

Johnson's business goal is to have more dairy cows within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is happily married, with two children and his own house.  Edson works as a radio taxi driver and his wife sells cheese to earn some money. Edson needs a loan to fix a room at his house, as the walls have deteriorated due to rain. Edson wants to have a better home to give more comfort to his family and also to have the chance to sell the place in the future, should he have the possibility to find something better for his family

loans.use: to fix a room at his house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy needed materials like bamboo sticks, etc. for her business.

Helen has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy needed materials like bamboo sticks, etc. for her nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is a married woman with seven children, of which two are in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rodita is 41 years old.

Rodita has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo leaves, etc..

Rodita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Rodita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo leaves, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 28 years old. 

He sells stones and he has been in this business for the past 3 years. 

With the loan, he would like to sell stones for construction to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare and to increase his savings.

loans.use: to sell stones for construction to resell.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en: Dancille is 33 years old, married and the mother of two children who are 2 and 9 years old. Her oldest child attends school. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a shop while her husband works as a farmer. She is requesting this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, including rice, sugar and salt. She will use the profits she expects to earn from her business to build a house. Her goal for the future is to earn a larger income —  at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more such as rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Aide

texts.es:
Nancy, a sus 40 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. Ser madre, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hijo. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 2 meses, comenzó a comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria a pesar del poco tiempo en funcionamiento. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 9 horas con 1 vendedor

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará calzado al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Nancy manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Nancy!
texts.en:
Nancy, age 40, is a charismatic, active, and service-oriented woman. She is a mother; this is her main motivation to work insatiably day in, day out, looking for alternatives to make a living and support her child.
Approximately two months ago, she started to buy shoes for all kinds of clients. Her footwear is of very good quality and has excellent prices. This has allowed her to get to know the sector and achieve a good trajectory in just a short time.
She works every day for nine hours with one vendor.
This has led her to request a loan to strengthen her investments. She will buy shoes wholesale in order to satisfy increasing demand. This will help her to improve her income.
Nancy says that her age does not stop her from continuing to do what she loves. She is always creating new goals for herself, including the goal of becoming a large shoe distributor and to generate employment opportunities. This way, she will be able to improve the quality of life and well-being of her family and those who help her work every day. Support Nancy's loan!

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children who are 7 and 15 years old. For the last five years, she has earned a living and helped support her family by owning a bar. She is requesting this loan to buy goats to raise and resell. She will use the profits she expects to earn from this loan to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy goats to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather, soles, thread, fasteners, and other supplies for making shoes.

loans.name: Shafii

texts.en:
Shafii is in his late 20s, married and has two daughters, one in school and the other still a baby. He runs three businesses. He manages his own garage where he repair motorbikes, sells spare parts for motorbikes, and owns a shop that sells cosmetics. Cosmetics was his first business and it succeeded with good management, providing funds to start his new business of selling spare parts. He really works hard and has been running these businesses for two years now. Working from 7:30 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily, Shafii is able to earn a good profit each month. 

He runs his businesses with assistance from his wife. He has approached Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, to request his second business loan. He will use his loan to replenish his spare parts business with more parts. Shafii desires to expand his shops and to be a successful father. He used the previous credit to buy spare parts. He is so thankful to everyone who will support his business. Shafii will be accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his spare parts business.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is 24 years old and married with two children, both in school. Ella works very hard to provide for her family.

Ella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Ella has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, biscuits, curls and other groceries. 

In the future, Ella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 28 years old. She is married with three children, who are between three and nine years old; two of them go to school. She owns a shop and has been in business for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer.

With the loan, she would like to buy more shoe polish, plates and Colgate to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. In future, she wishes to earn at least 250,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more shoe polish, plates and Colgate to sell.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe is 31 years old. She is married with five children, who are between one and nine years old; three of them go to school. She sells vegetables and has been in business for two years. Her husband is a carpenter.

With the loan, she would like to buy different items such as beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she wishes to earn at least 400,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy different items such as beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 34 years old and two of her children are in school.

Mary Ann has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wrappers (bitenge) to sell.

loans.name: Buzainap

texts.ru: Бузайнап очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Сегодня она также занимается торговлей одеждой на рынке города. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бузайнап обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара для увеличения товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Бузайнап планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Buzainap is very thankful to Kiva and everyone who helped to finance her. Today she also works in selling clothes at the city market. Her monthly income is about 20,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Buzainap has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS). This will allow her to buy goods to expand her goods turnover. Buzainap plans to invest the finances from the loan in the further augmentation of her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нурила, 40 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброжелательной и трудолюбивой женщине. Нурила в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1999 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец. Дополнительно у Нурилы есть земельный надел мерою 6,0 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль. Благодаря упорному труду Нурилы, ее деятельность приносит около 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurila is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has secondary education, and has very good testimonials from her neighbours. They speak of her as a benevolent and hardworking woman.

Nurila is the main breadwinner for her family, and from 1999 she has worked in animal husbandry and field-crop cultivation. There is a cow and ten sheep on her farm. Additionally, Nurila has an allotment of six hectares, on which she grows beans. Thanks to Nurila's persistent hard work, her business receives about 17,000 som (KGS) a month, which forms the basis of covering expenses for food and daily necessities for the family.

In order to further develop her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy heifers. Nurila plans to invest the finances from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy one heifer in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 35 years old, married, and has four children ages 1 to 14 years. Two children go to school. She owns a retail shop and she has been in business for five years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more biscuits, sugar and spoons to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 150,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, sugar and spoons to sell.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Maria aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su curiosidad y ganas de salir adelante, fue así como poco a poco Maria empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Es soltera y hace lo posible para superarse y vivir bien.
Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.

Madruga todos los días para trabajar en sus negocio durante 7 horas.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos de confección como tela, hilos y agujas. De este forma podrá aumentar su producción y tener mejores ventas.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria learned to sew clothing thanks to her curiosity and desire to succeed. Bit by bit, she started to understand and apply her knowledge.
She is single and does what she can to succeed and live well.
Maria is an enterprising, loving woman who is always ready to help her clients as best she can.
She is very grateful for everything she has been able to build up to now with the help of Corporación Interactuar.
She gets up early every day to work for seven hours.
She is requesting economic support to buy sewing supplies such as thread, needles, and fabric. This way, she will be able to increase her production and have better sales.
She has many hopes for her future and hopes to have a much bigger workshop where she will be able to offer employment and increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as thread, needles, and fabric.

loans.name: Marlenny

texts.es:
Marlenny, a sus 57 años de edad, es casada y muy emprendedora, Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado como vendedora en una tienda de abarrotes, la misma que hoy en día es de su propiedad pues decidió iniciar con este negocio impulsada por su vocación de independencia.

Allí trabaja sola todos los días, logrando generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

Su tenacidad, visión, perseverancia y optimismo le han permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con la gran cantidad de competidores que existen en el sector; sin embargo, ha sabido manejar la situación y ha aprovechado la ventaja de que el establecimiento ya cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en el mercado.

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor Como carne, legumbres, confitería y legumbres, así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda. 

Marlenny, con el sueño de ampliar su negocio, se visualiza en el momento que el establecimiento esté bien posicionado en el mercado y así poder acreditarlo para que crezca y perdure en el tiempo, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marlenny, age 57, is married and very enterprising. She once worked as a vendor in a grocery store which she now owns. She decided to do this because she is called to be independent.
She works alone every day at her store. She generates a sufficient income to cover her household's basic needs.
Her tenacity, vision, perseverance and optimism have allowed her to overcome various obstacles that have presented themselves, especially the great quantity of competitors in the sector. She has been able to manage the situation and has taken advantage of the fact that her establishment is already entrenched in the market.
She is requesting a loan with which to buy stock wholesale, such as meat, vegetables, and candy. This way, she will be able to stock up to cover demand.
Marlenny's dream is to expand her business. She plans to ensure that her business is well-established in the market and to improve her reputation so that her business can grow and prosper, improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale, such as meat, vegetables, and candy.

loans.name: Betza

texts.en:
Betza has been living at her parents' house since 3 years ago. 

She has a boyfriend and she makes cheese to earn some money. She learned to make cheese with her mother. Berta's boyfriend is a mason and occasionally he helps her, giving her some money. 

Betza needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she wants to sell more cheese and start selling milk. Betza doesn't have children but she takes care of her parents, so she hopes you can help her. 

In the picture, Betza appears holding the molds that she uses to make cheese. These molds are made of straw

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis is 61 years old and married with six children.

Flordelis works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Flordelis has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Flordelis aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Turakhon Group

texts.ru: Эта группа Турахон. Она состоит из Турахон и Гавхарби. Гахарби является матерью Турахона. Ей 61 год. Кроме Турахона у Гавхарби трое сыновей. Турахону 27 лет женат и пока не имеет детей. Он мечтает стать отцом. Турахон и Гавхарби занимаются куплей и продажей скотин. Это их семейных бизнес. В прочем, найти другую работу в маленьком городке не так просто. Они заняты животноводческой деятельностью около 5 лет. Они хотят расширить деятельность и купить пару голов скотин. Для их семьи доход от данной деятельности является очень важным. Они хотят поддержать бизнес и не потерять источника дохода. Турахон и Гавхарби надеются, что их кредит профинансируется и они заранее благодарят Вас за помощь.
texts.en:
This is Turakhon Group. It is composed of Turakhon and Gavharbi. Gavharbi is Turakhon's mother. She is 61 years old. Other than Turakhon, Gavhrabi has three sons. Turakhon is 27 years old and married, but does not have children yet. He dreams of becoming a father. 

Turakhon and Gavharbi work in buying and selling livestock. This is their family business. However, finding other work in a small town is not so simple. They have been occupied with cattle-raising work for about five years. They want to expand their work and buy a few heads of cattle.

The income from this work is very important to their family. They want to support the business and not lose a source of income. Turakhon and Gavharbi hope that their loan will be financed and they thank you for your help in advance.

loans.use: to acquire some cattle

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 54 years old, married and has six children ages 10 to 32 years. Four children go to school. She owns a butcher shop and she has been in business for five years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more meat to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow to raise. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 51-year-old married woman with four children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Remedios has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Remedios has been in this business for three years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products' and other groceries

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 31 years old. She is married with four children, who are between seven and 12 years old; they all go to school. She owns a shop and has been in business for two years. Her husband is a local constructor.

With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as soap, Colgate and books to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.
