loans.use: to buy more items such as soap, Colgate and books to sell.

loans.name: Haminsi

texts.en: Haminsi is 50 years old and is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 14 years.  2 of them go to school. He owns a mini market and has been in business for 3 years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy items such as milk, cake and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, he wishes to earn at least 150,000RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy items such as milk, cake and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Luis Octavio

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Luis es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales como jornalero.
Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.

 El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca lechera que le de un buen impulso a su negocio y que le permita incrementar su utilidad.


El negocio de Luis Necesita tu ayuda para salir adelante y progresar!
texts.en:
Farm labor is one of the most difficult forms of work today because it requires a great deal of effort to make progress. However, Luis is a man who has never given up because of the weather or the circumstances he has had to endure. He is always willing to do whatever it takes to acquire resources for his family.

Luis wakes up first thing in the morning so that he can travel to different farms to fulfill his work obligations as a day laborer. He divides his time between this job and selling the milk that he obtains from his own cows.

Luis wants to increase his working capital so that he can guarantee the sustainability of his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of a dairy cow. This will provide a good boost to his business so that he can increase his profits.

Luis needs assistance so that his business can move forward and make progress.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to boost his business.

loans.name: Jostina

texts.en: Jostina has been selling textiles (bitenge) for 10 years now and has managed to provide income from built rentals, from which she gets additional income. She lives in Kasese, Uganda, is aged 46, married with 4 children, who all go to school. She has a dream of having a happy and educated family. Jostina has asked for a loan to buy cloth wraparounds, locally called bitenge, for selling.

loans.use: to buy cloth wraparounds, locally called bitenge, for selling.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a hard working man residing in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in cattle trading, which he supplements with a motorcycle transport ("boda boda") business to increase his income.

He buys cattle and fattens them for selling within a short time. He has a dream of acquiring his own motor vehicle to reduce his cattle transportation costs and to enable him serve different markets.

Patrick needs a loan to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is a 46-year-old man from the village of Abastumani. He has a five-member family, and the main source of their income is from agricultural activities. 

Koba and his wife are engaged in cattle breeding and in cultivating a plot of family-owned land where nuts are grown. He realizes income from selling the agricultural products in the local market. Koba also works as a private artisan and gets a small income. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, he decided to start another business and include his daughter as a saleslady. Koba requested a loan among local credit providers. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Koba and his daughter will purchase stock of various kinds of clothing and will sell them with price mark-ups in their community. 

The loan will greatly assist Koba, and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is a 52-year-old married man from village Tkviavi. He has a wife, son and daughter-in-law, who works at the local restaurant. Teimuraz and his son cultivate family-owned agricultural land. They generate income from selling produce to local retailers. Their average monthly income is 250-300 GEL. It is hardly enough to buy food for a four-member family. Teimuraz requested a loan from Credo to re-start the business that he had several years ago. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides rural poor people business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions. These poor people do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the received credit, Teimuraz plans to start trading meat. He will have his own counter at the local open market, where the most people go for purchasing food products. Teimuraz will also trade harvested fruits and vegetables and will generate significant income. He has good experience with this type of business and will make it work on a profitable way. 
Teimuraz and his family members will be very grateful for the chance to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy meat, fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is married. She has four children and her own house. Raquel makes cheese to earn some money. She attends her cows and makes the cheese by herself (she learned about this business when she was very young). Raquel needs a loan to buy cattle. She is convinced she can do it better if she acquires more cows. Right now she needs help because her husband is unemployed. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 50 years old and married with 10 children.

Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of personal care products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like lotion, powder, etc.

Marlyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the personal care products business for three years and also earns income from a general store.

Marlyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like lotion, powder, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old, married, and has seven children. 

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20.000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been farming rice for 16 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
Es

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en: Gaspard is 54 years old. He is married with two children, aged 12 and 18 years. He sells foodstuffs and he has been in this business for the past one year. With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum, cassava and millet to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare and to increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, cassava and millet to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plaster and make floors for her rentals.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a 34-year-old man residing in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a boutique and started the business to meet his family's needs. He is a salary earner from a reputable institution and supplements this with proceeds from selling clothes. 

He wants to use the loan to buy second-hand clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 55-year-old, hardworking, married man with five children aged 28, 26, 24, 20 and 18. He is living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  

He has been able to look after his family from livestock, which is his main source of income. He also earns extra income from his side businesses of cake making, wedding gowns for hire and party decorations. He is optimistic of having a big developed business, a big farm and educated children, but has been limited by competition and prolonged drought.
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more bulls for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.en:
Luis Eduardo is 25 years old and single and he lives with his parents. 

He studies electronic engineering and also works selling mobile accessories and other electronic items. He has been working in retail for the last eight years. 

He is asking for a loan to buy some inventory for his store. 

His goal is to finish his college degree and then grow his business.

loans.use: To buy accessories for mobile phones and other electronic items to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Los Cerritos Group

texts.es:
Dúo los Cerritos
Doña Josefina es originaria del municipio de Tecpan, ella tiene 44 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus cuatro hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de el y al apoyo de su familia ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de mercadería, surtir su venta con mas variedad productos para una mejor atención a sus clientes.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, surtirlo con más variedad de productos asi ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
Duo Los Cerritos

Josefina is a native of the city of Tecpan. She is 44 years old, and she has four young children under her care. She makes a living selling clothes and making traditional clothing by hand. Her husband works as a day laborer. As a result of his support and the support of her family, she is able to move forward with her business.

She used the previous loan that she received to buy merchandise in order to stock her store with a greater variety of products, which has allowed her to serve her customers better. Her dream is to expand her business further, stocking it with a greater variety of products in order to obtain a higher income and send her children to school so that they can have a better future.

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy the basic supplies needed to make traditional clothing for sale.

loans.use: to buy the basic supplies needed to make traditional clothing for sale.

loans.name: Richsil Joy

texts.en: Richsil Joy is 42 years old from Badian, Cebu. She is married with three children, ages 8, 13 and 15. For two years, Richsil Joy has been selling sausage, ham and hot dogs. This allows her to earn an average income of 6000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to purchase more stocks to refill her fridge such as hot dogs, ham, sausage and bacon. She hopes that with the income she will be able to support the needs of her children for food and school.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, ham, sausage and bacon

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité MUJERES UNIDAS, es un grupo nuevo de la ciudad de Santaní, se encuentran en el primer ciclo con 17  integrantes, todas ellas se encuentran muy confiadas por el programa de comité de mujeres, de que les será de mucha ayuda.
La Sra. Candelaria es una de las integrantes de este comité, ella es muy guapa,  cría cerdos en cantidad, los faena y lo comercializa, es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha y se esfuerza por poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Así como la Sra. Candelaria, las demás integrantes del comité son todas trabajadoras e independientes y muy trabajadoras.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cerdos para la cría, como también de balanceados para sus animales. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The WOMEN UNITED group consists of 17 members from the city of Santaní, that is in its first loan cycle. All of the group members are confident that the Women's Committee program will benefit them. 

One of the members is Señora Candelaria, an attractive woman who raises pigs for a living and sells the meat. She is a very industrious woman who strives diligently to support her loved ones and provide them all of the things she never had. Like Señora Candelaria, the other Women United members are hardworking and independent. 

Señora Candelaria is applying for a loan for the purchase of pigs to raise, as well as feed for her herd. She is grateful for this opportunity to keep growing her business and prosper.

loans.use: Comprar cerdos para la cría y balanceados

loans.name: Aura Rosa

texts.es:
Aura es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, arepas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Aura y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Aura desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Aura is an unassuming and hard working woman, who has spent a large part of her life caring for her children. She lives in the La Dorada municipality from where she works wonders in the kitchen, as her business is the preparation of meals made to order such as tamales, chorizos, empanadas and arepas (corn pancakes) among other things.

She sells these foods mainly to the local inhabitants of the area, who know Aura's flavours and know that they will always be getting delicious and well prepared food.

Aura wishes to increase her food sales and would like to work in a more comfortable way. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy various kitchen utensils and to buy ingredients like chicken, flour, cheese and other items, to continue making her recipes.

This loan will allow her to move her business forward and thus obtain the income necessary to afford her the opportunity to continue to support her family, an opportunity that is offered by Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy various kitchen utensils and to buy ingredients like chicken, flour, cheese and other items, so she can continue making her recipes.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a resident of Badian, Cebu. She is 56 years old, widowed with five children, who are already grown. For the last two years, Alicia has been engaged in a Sari-sari (convenience) store business to earn a living. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy stocks of goods to sell, such as detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and sugar. Her income will be utilized for a healthy diet, household expenses and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods to sell such as detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 48 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosenda requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of fish to sell.

Rosenda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rosenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy containers of fish to sell

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Gladys es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad.

Gladys vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Gladys tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital, busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal al por mayor como lociones, cremas, gel, entre otros y responder así a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Le dedica 5 horas diarias a su negocio.
Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very hard-working person who, as a result of her daily effort, has been able to move her three children forward, providing them with a good-quality education. Gladys lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. 

A long time ago, she started selling personal use products by catalog. With great effort, she has overcome many problems that she has encountered. Currently, Gladys has some very good orders from her customers; however, since she does not have great capital, she is requesting a loan to buy personal use products at wholesale such as lotions, creams, and gels, among others, so that she can fill the large orders of her customers.

She dedicates five hours per day to her business. Her greatest dream is to move forward with her business in order to be able to offer her children a good quality of life as well as greater economic stability. She knows that she will be able to achieve this with the help of Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy personal use products at wholesale such as lotions, creams, and gels, among others.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia is 61 years old and studied accounting in a public university in Mexico.  She works providing accounting services to seven small clients. She has been doing it for the last seven years. Silvia is asking for a loan to pay for some health related exams. She is a Kubo Financiero client and in the past she has taken a loan and repaid it on time.

loans.use: To pay for some health related exams.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a 52-year-old food vendor from Badian, Cebu. She is married to a farmer and they have a son aged 17. Estrella sells home-cooked dishes like sauteed vegetables, fried fish and snacks. She is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, purified water, seasoning and spices. Estrella hope that she can help her husband through the income from her business and send her son to school. In the future, she plans to make her business bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, purified water, seasoning and spices

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosario requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Rosario has been in this business for 27 years now.

Rosario would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 30 years old, married, with two children, one of which is currently in school.

Helen is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Michelle works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Michelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials, such as fishing net, fish containers, gasoline, etc., for her fishing business.

Michelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, such as fishing net, fish containers, gasoline, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Romielyn

texts.en:
Romielyn is 22 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Romielyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her business.

Romielyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 46 years old.

Carmelita has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for six years. Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evangeline has been in this business for three years now.

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jacque Lou

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jacque Lou works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jacque Lou is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more items of ready-to-wear, like shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc., to sell.

Jacque Lou has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items of ready-to-wear clothing, like shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca is 28 years old and married with two children.

Ciriaca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, noodles, etc., to sell.

Ciriaca has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Ciriaca aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, noodles, etc., to sell.
